She led the group of thirteen Aes Sedai who declared themselves Black Ajah and fled the White Tower, murdering guards and even sisters in the process. Liandrin was Red Ajah before turning to the Black, but her oath to the Black was sworn before even being raised to the Accepted (perhaps before she came to the Tower), so it cannot really be said that she was ever Red Ajah at all. She was shielded by [Moghedien](#Moghedien) for attempting to Compel her and given to a very enthusiastic [Temaile](#Temaile-Kinderode) to torture. She has since been given to [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath) as a _da'covale_.

name: Lidya
info: _Damane_ in service of [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag). She appears to have the Talent of Foretelling—she was able to read Tuon's fortune, in a way, before they landed at Ebou Dar. She was caned because Tuon did not like what she told her. Tuon later apologized, realizing that Lidya had only told the truth. What Lidya told her was: “Beware the fox that makes the ravens fly, for he will marry you and carry you away. Beware the man who remembers [Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Paendrag-Tanreall)'s face, for he will marry you and set you free. Beware the man of the red hand, for him you will marry and none other.”

name: Lieutenant-General Turan
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Lieutenant-General in the Seanchan armies. He sent reports to [Galgan](#Captain-General-Lunal-Galgan) about the campaigns of [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde).

name: Lieutenant Tzigan Sokorin
info: Ghealdanin under-lieutenant in the Queen's Guards of Andor, and a member of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s personal bodyguard. She claims to be the daughter of a minor noble, and was a Hunter for the Horn before joining the Guards.

name: Lincora
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: One of the First Twelve of the Atha'an Miere. She and the rest of the Twelve deliberately turned their backs on [Harine](#Harine-din-Togara-Two-Winds) to show their disdain for her failure.

name: Lini Eltring
info: Childhood nurse to [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain), [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) Trakand. She has many wise sayings, which Elayne and Morgase are fond of quoting to themselves and others (probably because they have been ingrained into their minds so much). She went with Morgase when she fled Andor to Amadicia, and now serves as [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s chief maid. She is bony, and has white hair. In Faile's absence, she works with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to get her back.

name: Lirene Doirellin
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She resigned as a Sitter fifteen years ago and went into “voluntary” retreat. She is now nervous and shifty. She grew up in Cairhien; she is slightly shorter than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Llyw
info: [Kairen](#Kairen-Stang)'s Warder. He was bonded by [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) after Kairen was killed; Myrelle has been heard to say that she hates watching Warders die. Clearly Llyw was no exception.

name: Logain Ablar
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who created war in Ghealdan and surrounding nations before being captured and gentled by the Red Ajah. He got loose during the chaos surrounding the deposing of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), and eventually was escorted out of Tar Valon by Siuan and her traveling companions. Before he was gentled he was of considerable strength, and attracted quite a following of loyal soldiers. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) still has viewings of him with a halo over his head, which she thinks indicates that he will become a figure of great power sometime in the future. Recently, Logain later came forward with information that indicated that the Red Ajah actually put him up to declaring himself the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), most likely with the pretext that bringing down a false Dragon would bring more glory than gentling a simple man who could channel. Logain was recently Healed by [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and was let free by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to do as he pleased. He chose to go to the Black Tower, and now leads a part of the Asha'man that seem to be discontent with [Taim](#Mazrim-Taim)'s leadership. When Aes Sedai came to the Black Tower to attempted to capture the Asha'man (not realizing their numbers), Logain bonded two sisters to him as “wives” using the “wife bond” that the Asha'man developed, [Toveine Gazal](#Toveine-Gazal) of the Red Ajah and [Gabrelle](#Gabrelle) of the Brown Ajah. He has curly black hair and broad shoulders. Logain was actually a minor Ghealdanin noble before his titles were stripped away when he declared himself the Dragon Reborn.

name: Loial
info: Son of [Arent](#Arent) son of [Halan](#Halan), an Ogier from Stedding Shangtai. He left the _stedding_ at around age 90 to see the world; by Ogier standards, he is not yet old enough to leave the _stedding_ without permission from the Council of Elders. He is fond of books and history, and is an excellent Treesinger. He is writing a book about his travels with the three _ta'veren_ he meets, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). Loial is constantly afraid that his mother will find him and try to marry him off and settle him down; however, he does like his mother's choice of wives for him, [Erith](#Erith). He, like most of the Ogier, is sad that most humans do not remember the Ogier, and is horrified that some even think he is a Trolloc on first seeing him.

name: Londraed
info: Officer in the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Long Tooth
info: Name the wolves give to [Elyas Machera](#Elyas-Machera); the name is used because of the long knife Elyas uses to hunt with, which the wolves see as a long metal tooth.

name: Lopin
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He has a round belly, little hair, a blocky face, and a beard that nearly reaches his chest. He grew up in Tear.

name: Lord Abelle Pendar
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but she hopes he will still support her when she comes to reclaim the throne. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) hopes he will support her claim to the throne. He seems to disappear easily and at random, and for now he is effectively in hibernation from the point of view of Andoran politics.

name: Lord Agelmar Jagad
info: [Easar](#King-Easar-Togita)'s general in Shienar. He is possibly the best military commander alive (excepting possibly [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), the Aiel chiefs, and a few Seanchan commanders).

name: Lord Algarin Pendaloan
info: Lesser Lord of the Land in Tear. He has a wrinkly face and a white beard. He provided accomodations for [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin), [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin), [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), and the rest of their group on his manor so they could recuperate from the events at Shadar Logoth. His younger brother Emarin could channel, and Algarin wants to be tested for the ability now as well. While he is away at the Black Tower, Rand is using his estates in Tear to lay low for a while.

name: Lord Aubrem Pensenor
info: Head of a minor House in Andor. He was among the first to ride for [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. He is lean and craggy with a bale head save for a thin white fringe. He was also among the first to arrive in Caemlyn in support of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and brought news that it was [Arymilla](#Arymilla-Marne) who was marching against the city.

name: Lord Bertain Gallenne
info: Commander of [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron)'s Winged Guards, and her personal bodyguard of sorts. He is missing one eye, and wears a leather patch over it. He has shoulder-length gray hair.

name: Lord Branlet Gilyard
info: High Seat of House Gilyard. He is a boy with unruly black curly hair and blue eyes that are too big for his face. He pledged the support of his House to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) during his first ever visit to Caemlyn. He is about thirteen years old; his voice is in the process of deepening.

name: Lord Brelan
info: Character in a song sung in the hell in Maderin to which [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) takes [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag).

name: Lord Captain Commander Eamon Valda
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light after the death of [Pedron Niall](#Pedron-Niall). He killed Niall's assassin shortly after the act, but it is not known whether this was set up, or whether Valda just happened to be in the right place at the right time. One of his first acts was to dismiss Niall's secretary, [Sebban Balwer](#Sebban-Balwer), for “someone who didn't twitch.” This was a mistake, as Balwer was Niall's _true_ Master of Spies—he knows more about spying than anyone else in the world. Valda offered assistance to [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand), as Niall had promised, but before doing so he required a “service” of her: to share his bed. Morgase escaped during the Seanchan attack, and Valda believes her to be dead. He has since fallen into disfavor with the Children of the Light, most especially with [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred), because of his dealings with Morgase; Galad because she is his stepmother, and with the other Children because she trained with the “witches” in Tar Valon.

name: Lord Conail Northan
info: High Seat of House Northan. He is tall and lean, has bony arms, an engaging grin, merry brown eyes, and an eagle's beak of a nose. He is not much older than sixteen. He thinks [Arymilla](#Arymilla-Marne) is incompetant, and pledged the support of his House to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Lord Davram t'Ghaline Bashere
info: Lord of Bashere, Tyr, and Sidonia; Guardian of the Blightborder; Defender of the Heartland; Marshal-General to Queen Tenobia of Saldaea. He is also her uncle, and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s father. He has black eyes, a beak-like nose, and a mustache. He is also slender, and shorter than most men; his wife towers over him. He left Saldaea with his army on an order from Tenobia to bring her the head of [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) after he escaped; he ended up in Caemlyn when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) defeated [Rahvin](#Rahvin). He now commands Rand's troops in Caemlyn (those that cannot channel and are not under the command of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) or one of the Aiel chiefs). He is feared by any potential opponents in battle, and with reason—he is one of the best generals alive.

name: Lord Dobraine Taborwin
info: Cairienin lord. He is the High Seat of House Taborwin, and commanded the troops [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) led to Dumai's Wells. He is little taller than [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and has dark eyes and gray hair. He keeps the front of his head shaved, and keeps the gray hair on the sides to his shoulders. He was the only Cairhienin noble to retain a sizable force after the Shaido invasion. He is the Steward of Cairhien for the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn); he rules the country in [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s absence, and serves as his advisor in his presence.

name: Lord Estean Andiama
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: Son of High Lord Torean of Tear. He used to play cards with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) in Tear. He came out to meet [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) near Cairhien.

name: Lord Gaebril
info: Man who came to Caemlyn just as riots sprang up throughout the city. He joined and led the faction that restored order in the city, and upon [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s return, he gave her her kingdom in one piece, as it was when she left. Allegedly, she was so happy that he had done this that she made Gaebril her new advisor. However, during [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s trip through Caemlyn to deliver [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s letter, Mat overheard Gaebril ordering someone to kill Elayne and anyone else with her—he tried to find a way to report this information to Morgase, but ended up telling Elayne. Gaebril was discovered to be [Rahvin](#Rahvin), one of the Forsaken, who has a preference to having pretty women around him. His “pretty woman” was Morgase, and he planned to wrest control of Andor from her. Morgase realized he was controlling her and left the country so quickly a rumor sprang up that she had been killed; when Caemlyn was taken by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and Rahvin killed, the rumor changed to say that Rand had killed Morgase, instead of Gaebril.

name: Lord Gareth Bryne
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Former First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Queen's Guards under [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) in Andor. He was appointed to the position because Morgase had no living male relatives, but was exiled from Caemlyn on a suggestion from Morgase's new advisor, [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). He moved to his private estates in rural Andor, where he presided over the trial of three young women who unintentionally burned a barn: they turned out to be [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), the former [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat); [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), the former [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), and [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw). When these three made an oath to serve him and then apparently broke it, he followed them out of sheer curiosity to Salidar. Once there, he discovered the true identity of the three, as well as that the Tower was truly broken. The Aes Sedai in Salidar persuaded him to command the army they would need to take the Amyrlin Seat from [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan), since he was the only commander that the Warders thought would be willing and able to help them. He is one of the six best military commanders west of the Aiel Waste, in a league with [Pedron Niall](#Pedron-Niall), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), and [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). Although neither of them would admit it, Bryne seems to be developing feelings for Siuan Sanche; he wishes to avoid another mistake like his relationship as [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s lover, and also never forgave Siuan for when she publicly shamed him years ago. She seems to be developing similar feelings for him, much to her dismay. He planned to be the first general to take the city of Tar Valon; the closest anyone else ever came was with Guaire Amalasan's armies, who got as far as the White Tower itself, and [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Paendrag-Tanreall), who never managed to go beyond beseiging the city. Actually, Amalasan's troops never beseiged the city, they simply managed to breech the walls; Hawkwing never managed to stop the supply ships coming up the river. Bryne thought he will be able to overcome this problem by purchasing ships along the way to Tar Valon, but when [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) brought the entire army to Tar Valon by Traveling, that plan faltered; instead, he is pressuring her to let him use gateways to breach the walls and get inside the city. He is stocky, with a bluff face. The years have given him some sort of comforting calmness. Men always follow him—they have learned from history that doing so is the path to military victory. Bryne taught [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) to practice the sword with both hands alternating to avoid weakness.

name: Lord Jarid Sarand
info: [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand)'s husband, the High Seat of House Sarand. A square-faced man, he is dark for an Andorman. During the Succession, Jared's House opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand); after she became Queen, he was only allowed into the Palace on state occasions. When [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) killed [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) and took control of Caemlyn until he could find [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), Jarid tried to make himself fall into favor, thinking he could gain power with the new ruler. He and his wife have been exiled, and now support [Arymilla](#Arymilla-Marne)'s claim to the Lion Throne, but if Elenia attempts to claim the throne for herself, Elayne expects him to assist her. He is very honorable, almost too much so.

name: Lord Lir Baryn
info: “Whip of a man” who always wears a sword. He was one of the nobles who opposed [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Slender and strong, he is the High Seat of House Baryn. He was exiled from the Palace except for official functions by Morgase after she took the Lion Throne, but he invited himself back when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) forced [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) out of town. He has since been exiled again by [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand). His sign is a wing and hammer.

name: Lord Luan Norwelyn
info: Andoran noble, High Seat of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but hoped he would still support her when she returned to claim the throne. [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) also hopes he will support _her_ claim to the throne despite Morgase's actions. He leads one of the small armies that encountered [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and her group of Aes Sedai on their way to Tar Valon. His retainers have effectively disappeared from Elayne's view, and she remains uncertain whether he will support her claim to the Lion Throne.

name: Lord Nasin Caeren
info: Andoran noble, High Seat of House Caeren. He gave [Arymilla](#Arymilla-Marne) lodging during her attempts to take the Lion Throne. He has thin white hair, and is stark raving mad. He believes himself betrothed to [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand), despite the fact that she is married.

name: Lord Nathin Sarmain Vendare
info: Lord of Maderin.

name: Lord Pelivar Coelan
info: Andoran noble, leader of a strong House that supported [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) during the Succession. Morgase exiled him from Caemlyn as per [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril)'s suggestion, but she hoped he would still support her when she came to reclaim the throne. He is one of the lords in Andor who arrested [Naean](#Lady-Naean-Arawn) and [Elenia](#Lady-Elenia-Sarand) for claiming the Lion Throne; he later led the Andoran troops that confronted the Aes Sedai led by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). He is hesistant to support [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s claim to the Lion Throne, and instead wants [Dyelin](#Lady-Dyelin-Taravin) to assume the Throne.

name: Lord Perival Mantear
info: High Seat of House Mantear. He is a pretty, golden-haired boy. He pledged the support of House Mantear to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) on his first trip to Caemlyn. His House controlled the Lion Throne until the death of [Queen Mordrellen](#Queen-Mordrellen-Mantear), both because the Daughter-Heir disappeared and because the family had become heavy with male children.

name: Lord Rodel Ituralde
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: General of the army of Arad Doman. He is one of the greatest commanders alive, along with [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), and a few Aiel clan chiefs. He keeps a neatly-trimmed mustache, and a ruby in his left ear. He is short in stature. He is called the Wolf by his peers—when the Wolf calls, they follow his lead. He is currently leading a band of Taraboners and Domani to wreak havoc among the Seanchan.

name: Lord Rodrivar Tihera
info: Lean noble from Tear (a very minor noble). Dark even for a Tairen, he has a short beard trimmed to a point. He is the Captain of the Stone of Tear, the man who leads the Defenders.

name: Lord Toram Riatin
info: Cairhienin lord, son of King Galldrian. He is a Blademaster. He opposed [Colavaere](#Colavaere-Saighan), and is in league with [Caraline](#Lady-Caraline-Damodred) and [Darlin](#High-Lord-Darlin-Sisnera) against [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). He was last seen running off into the fog of Mashadar that [Fain](#Padan-Fain) released, and is presumed dead.

name: Lord of Chaos
info: Reference to chaos in general. The phrase is “let the Lord of Chaos rule,” the command the [Dark One](#Dark-One) gave to his followers. The use of this phrase by [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) is the most recent of many indications that he is a Darkfriend.

name: Lord of the Morning
info: Title by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known by during the War of the Shadow. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) uses it when he wants to make a point.

name: Lothair Mantelar
info: Founder of the Children of the Light and author of _The Way of the Light_, the Bible of the Whitecloaks. The book is so revered among the Children that those who cannot read are taught so that they can study Mantelar's words. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) once read a few pages of it, and considered them “dry nonsense,” but [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) thought Mantelar's words to be brilliant.

name: Loversknot
info: [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran)'s horse.

name: Lusara
info: Buxom Domani taken _gai'shain_ by the Shaido. She was formerly a merchant. She is in her middle years, and has black hair with white streaks in it. She is sworn to [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara).

name: M'Hael
info: Title used by [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim) as the head of the Black Tower. It means “Leader” in the Old Tongue.

name: Macoll
info: Bannerman in the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Madoc Comadrin
info: General, long dead, and author of _Fog and Steel_. [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) remembers reading his book in a past life; he doubts a copy exists today. He met him once, about six hundred years before [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Paendrag-Tanreall) was born, after Mat lost a battle to him.

name: Madwin
info: Officer in the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Mageen
info: [Aviendha](#Aviendha)'s horse. Her name means “daisy” in the Old Tongue. She is a gentle, placid mare tending toward stoutness.

name: Magla Daronos
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She is a Sitter, and is firmly in [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s camp. She has broad shoulders. She grew up in Illian.

name: Maighdin Dorlain
info: Penniless young woman that [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) encountered while she was fleeing Amadicia. She did not reveal her true identity, [Morgase Trakand](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor—she uses her mother's first name as a disguise. She became one of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s servants, much to her own dismay (being used to _commanding_ the servants, not being one), and was eventually captured by the Shaido and made _gai'shain_. She is beginning to adapt to her new status, though she has lost none of the toughness that made her such an effective ruler.

name: Mair
info: Plump, blue-eyed Arafellin Accepted in the White Tower. She was a novice when [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) came to the Tower, and was jealous of her fast rise to the Accepted. She is fond of giving Egwene orders in their new relationship.

name: Malind Nachenin
info: Plump Sitter for the Green Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She has a round, pretty face with full lips and dark, fierce eyes like those of an eagle. She is from Kandor. She was raised after the sisters banded together in Salidar. She once proposed an “appeal” (i.e., demand) to area nobles for assistance in building their army.

name: Managan
info: Young man from Malkier. He refused to wear the _hadori_.

name: Mandarb
info: [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s black stallion. His name means “Blade” in the Old Tongue.

name: Manderic
info: Shaido warrior. He is [Chiad](#Chiad)'s taskmaster. Chiad reports that he has bad breath and starts getting drunk as soon as he is awake.

name: Mandevwin
info: Stocky one-eyed member of the Band of the Red Hand. He was with the Band from its first days in Cairhien. He has gray streaks in his hair.

name: Mantual
info: Stocky servant to [Gamel Loune](#Gamel-Loune).

name: Marah
info: Stocky Murandian novice in the White Tower with mischievous blue eyes. She is about 15–16 years old.

name: Mareil
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: One of the First Twelve of the Atha'an Miere. Her shoulder-length hair is as much white as it is black. She has been friends with [Harine](#Harine-din-Togara-Two-Winds) since they were deckhands together.

name: Marille
info: Seanchan _damane_ captured by the Asha'man, now in Caemlyn. She, like many other _damane_, is convinced that she _needs_ to be collared, to protect others.

name: Marillin Gemalphin
chapter: Chapter 31: The House on Full Moon Street
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Brown. She is fond of cats, and is rarely seen without one. She is skinny, has a narrow face, and a wide nose.

name: Marli Noichin
info: Seanchan _sul'dam_ captured by the Asha'man, now in Caemlyn. She has finally admitted that she sees the weaves of _saidar_.

name: Marris Thornhill
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, part of [Atuan Larisett](#Atuan-Larisett)'s heart. She is openly Brown Ajah and grew up in Andor. She is very mild and always absorbed in study. Her “one other” is currently out of the Tower.

name: Masema Dagar
info: The [Prophet](#The-Prophet-of-the-Dragon). He was once one of Uno's underlings, and the one who respected [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) the least, but after he found out that Rand was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), he went his own way, preaching of Rand's glory as the “Lord Dragon Reborn.” Rand has since dispatched [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to bring Masema back into line. He is stark raving mad, and very dangerous. He even claims that Masema Dagar is dead, and that he has been resurrected as the Prophet of the Dragon Reborn. He is described as a dark, frowning man of average size with a faded arrow-scar on his cheek. He cares nothing for appearances, least of all his own. He has deep-set, almost black eyes.

name: Master Camrin
info: Altaran who asks [Vane](#Vane) why he is leaving after only one toss against [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). He sells lacquerware.

name: Master Kostelle
info: Altaran man with a triple chin who sells lacquerware.

name: Master Roidelle
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: Cartographer for the Band of the Red Hand. He has a round face and graying hair.

name: Master of the Blades
info: The next step up from Swordmaster among the Sea Folk. It is the highest position a man can hold amoung them. He protects the [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships).

name: Masuri Sokawa
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She grew up in Arafel, and was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She is now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company. She is taller than [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan) by a hand. One of her largest interests as a Brown is the history of Darkhounds; she has been in contact with more Darkhound packs than just about anyone else alive (save the Forsaken).

name: Matoun
info: Leader of [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere)'s lancers.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: Young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. Along with his good friends, [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), he left home to escape the Trolloc attacks after Winternight. On the way to Tar Valon, he picked up a dagger from Shadar Logoth tainted with the evil that destroyed Aridhol, which he carried with him for a long time. He was separated from the dagger by Aes Sedai Healing, but doing so caused large gaps in his memory sequence. These gaps were filled and more when he passed through the twisted door to the land of the Eelfinn, where he was granted his three requests: a foxhead medallion that protects him from women's channeling, a way out of the land of the Eelfinn, and the memories of past lifetimes that were the gaps in his memory. Mat's _ta'veren_ qualities manifest themselves particularly well with random events, such as dice games—he almost never loses a toss of the dice, even if the dice are weighted. He has found that battles are the ultimate form of gambling, and along with his newfound memories he can win almost every battle he fights quite decisively. He has four sisters, including Eldrin and [Bodewhin](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon), who are 16 and 17, respectively. His father Abell is one of the best archers in the Two Rivers, possibly in the World. Mat has gotten in the habit of carrying concealed knives under his clothes in case he is attacked—his collection would surprise anyone. In the Waste, he met a woman named Melindhra, a Maiden of the Spear from the Shaido Clan. However, she was not the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons), who Mat is destined to marry according to the Aelfinn; besides, she tried to kill him on orders from her master among the Darkfriends. Mat had to kill her to save his own skin, but regretted it deeply. He also has a scar along his neck from where the Eelfinn tried to kill him—which was also in accordance with what the Aelfinn told him, that he is “to die and live again.” He created an army called the Band of the Red Hand, after the army of King Aemon of old Manetheren, and served in a way as Rand's personal general—this worked well, since Mat seems to be a better general than even [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), who has earned his reputation as one of the best commanders alive. Mat does not trust any Aes Sedai, and because of this refuses to take his foxhead medallion off even to take a bath. Mat went to Ebou Dar to try to keep an eye on [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) and prevent them from getting themselves killed. While there he was cornered by [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar), who gave him little choice but to become her lover. When the Sea Folk and the Seanchan did battle in the city, he made his escape, leaving Tylin tied up under the bed so it looked “official”—Tylin was found torn limb from limb, obviously by the _gholam_ which was no doubt sent to kill Mat. In the process of leaving, Mat also took several _sul'dam_ and _damane_ (who were subsequently freed from their collars), and even kidnapped [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag), the [Daughter of the Nine Moons](#Daughter-of-the-Nine-Moons) herself. Mat is traveling with [Valan Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show now, to keep out of Seanchan sight.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who wreaked havoc in Saldaea before being captured by Aes Sedai. He later escaped his captors, possibly with Black Ajah assistance (although this is totally unconfirmed). Hearing of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s amnesty, Taim came to Caemlyn and became the head of Rand's school of male channelers, now dubbed the Black Tower. He is almost as strong in the One Power as Rand is. Taim claims to have held off the madness that normally accompanies the taint for almost 35 years—he has been using the One Power for a very long time, and knows many tricks that Rand had not thought of on his own or been taught by [Asmodean](#Asmodean), such as how to test men for the ability. He seems to resent being second to Rand, and also gave orders to kill Rand. He is almost as tall as Rand, has a hooked nose and dark eyes. He is a physically powerful and graceful man, although his skill with a sword is lacking. He gives special training to about 20 or 30 men—they are the only ones who wear the dragon besides [Logain](#Logain-Ablar). There is also little doubt that every last one of them is a Darkfriend, as is Taim.

name: Medore Damara
info: Head of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s new servants, a Tairen woman who tries to imitate the Aiel Maidens of the Spear, only using swords instead of spears. She is tall and has bright blue eyes and a dark face. Her father is [High Lord Astoril](#High-Lord-Astoril-Damara). She is a member of the _Cha Faile_ (Falcon's Talon) sept of the Aiel imitators. She and her cohorts now serve as scouts and spies for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: Mehtan
info: Clerk who works for [Faloun](#Captain-Blasic-Faloun) in Seanchan-controlled Amador. He is younger than [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). He died as beetles poured forth from his mouth.

name: Meidani
info: Tall, slender Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She has dark golden hair. Her Warder is Leonin. She was one of the Aes Sedai sent back to the Tower by the Aes Sedai in Salidar as a spy under the guise that she was obeying Elaida's summons.

name: Meira
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna). She is not as hard as [Therava](#Therava), but that is not saying much. She is shorter than [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). She has a round mouth and blue eyes like sapphires. She is from the White Cliff sept.

name: Melaine
info: Wise One of the of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. She is a Dreamwalker, and was one of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s teachers. She can channel. She swore she would never love a man, but changed her mind later and married [Bael](#Bael), her clan chief, thus becoming sister-wife to [Dorindha](#Dorindha). She has sun-colored hair and green eyes. She is currently expecting twin daughters.

name: Melare
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai involved in the capture of [Leane](#Leane-Sharif). She has very expressive eyebrows. She adores conversation. She sends money at regular intervals to Andor to pay for her great nephews' education, she had done for her nephews and nieces.

name: Melavaire Someinellin
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She is a stout, short, Cairhienin with white flecks in her dark hair.

name: Melfane Dawlish
info: Niece of [Essande](#Essande-Dawlish) and dispenser of herbs and ointments. She runs a shop on Candle Street in New Caemlyn. She is a midwife.

name: Melitene
info: [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s _der'sul'dam_. She is skilled in more than just training _sul'dam_. Less black than gray in her hair.

name: Merana Ambrey
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah with hazel eyes. She is now an apprentice of the Wise Ones. The events following Dumai's Wells shook her so deeply that [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin) thinks she will never quite recover herself. [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) says that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) should be able to trust her. She is one of those now sworn to obey him.

name: Merilille Ceandevin
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. Tiny, slender, and palely elegant, she has glossy black hair and large liquid eyes. She grew up in Cairhien, and has been Aes sedai for more than 100 years. She was originally sent to Ebou Dar to convince [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) to support the Salidar Aes Sedai.

name: Merise Haindehl
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah from Tarabon. She has dark hair and very blue eyes. She has three Warders, including [Jahar Narishma](#Jahar-Narishma), one of the Asha'man.

name: Mervin Poel
info: Inventor in the Academy who has invented a steam-powered wagon. It does not work very well yet, and has caused a few explosions, but it has promise. He has taken to parading his invention down the streets of Tear recently, causing much excitement among the local population.

name: Merym
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She ran off immediately to tell [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) (or someone else in the Tower) who it was they had captured at South Harbor.

name: Mesaana
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, Mesaana was told she was unfit to do research at the Collam Daan, but was capable of teaching others. She spent her years teaching until the Bore was opened and she dedicated her life to the [Dark One](#Dark-One). During the War of Power, she created “schools” for the children, at which she taught the children to spy on their parents and other such things. After her release from the Bore, Mesaana set herself up in the White Tower, where she could control events without anyone suspecting she was behind them. She has been cooperating with [Semirhage](#Semirhage) to some extent, and has taught [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) to Travel. She was displeased that Alviarin had ordered [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) beaten.

name: Metwyn
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He is the best among the Redarms with a sword. He looks like a boy, despite being about ten years older than Mat. He grew up in Cairhien, and has a weakness for tavern brawls. He shares a tent with [Harnan](#Harnan), [Gorderan](#Gorderan), and [Fergin](#Fergin).

name: Mirane Larinen
info: Owner of a doll [Derys](#Derys-Nermala) found in a cupboard. She ran away from the Kin, or so it was thought, but as she carried the doll _everywhere_, it stands to reason that she is either trying very hard to convince herself that she is a changed woman, or she is dead.

name: Mistress Alstaing
info: Taraboner present during [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s dice game. She is interested in purchasing lacquerware from [Camrin](#Master-Camrin) and [Kostelle](#Master-Kostelle).

name: Mistress Andscale
info: One of the two most prominent bankers in Caemlyn. She agreed to lend [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) 20,000 gold crowns when he was informed that alum had been discovered on Elayne's estates.

name: Mistress Anford
info: Graying worker in the Andoran Royal Palace. She reports to [Birgitte](#Birgitte).

name: Mistress Zigane
info: One of the Kin; she helps [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) by making gateways to move soldiers. She brought [Guybon](#Captain-Charlz-Guybon) into the city.

name: Mistress of Novices
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: The Aes Sedai who is in charge of training novices and Accepted in the White Tower. The post was held by [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) of the Blue Ajah until a coup that deposed [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) chased her out of the Tower. The post is now held by [Silviana Brehon](#Silviana-Brehon) in Tar Valon and [Tiana Noselle](#Tiana-Noselle) among the Aes Sedai who fled to Salidar. Another Mistress of Novices of the past was Seraille Bagand, who later became the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat).

name: Mistress of the Ships
info: Commander of the entire fleet of Sea Folk vessels. The post was held by [Nesta din Reas Two Moons](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons) until she was executed by the Seanchan for rebellion.

name: Miyasi
info: Tall, plump Aes Sedai of the White Ajah with iron-gray hair. She is stern and strong.

name: Miyora
info: Plump leopard trainer in [Valan Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show.

name: Modarra
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She would be slim if she was not taller than Someryn. Since she is, she can only be called lean, and pretty.

name: Moghedien
info: One of the Forsaken. Her name means “Spider” in the Old Tongue. She always works from safety, attacks from safety, and will run unless she can do so. She developed a command of _Tel'aran'rhiod_ that surpassed even [Lanfear](#Lanfear)'s mastery—in the real world, Lanfear was more powerful, but even she could not top Moghedien in the World of Dreams. After being released from the Bore, Moghedien eventually found herself in Tanchico, in the Palace of the Panarch of Tarabon. While there, she chanced upon [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran), who was trying to save the Panarch at the time and take the seal on the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s prison from its hold in the Palace. She and Nynaeve fought in a duel to the last, and Nynaeve managed to better Moghedien, much to the surprise of both of them. She managed to escape Nynaeve's tied off shield, and on their next encounter, this one in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, she ripped [Birgitte](#Birgitte)'s soul out of the World of Dreams after Birgitte almost killed her. On her third encounter with Nynaeve, Nynaeve managed to trap Moghedien with an _a'dam_. Moghedien remained bound by that _a'dam_ in Salidar, disguised as Marigan, but was released by [Halima](#Halima-Saranov). Halima was actually one of the Forsaken, and she took Moghedien to Shayol Ghul to be bound by a _coursouvra_, a Mind Trap, controlled by [Moridin](#Moridin). Typical of her ways, she has been keeping a low profile.

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Born of a noble House in Cairhien, she is Taringail Damodred's youngest half-sister, and King Laman's niece. She is considered short among her people, and the Cairhienin are already a short people. When it was discovered that she had the ability to channel inborn, Moiraine went to Tar Valon to become an Aes Sedai. Just before being raised to the shawl, she and her friend [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) witnessed Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). Moiraine and Siuan walked away from each other and did not speak to each other again (at least in public), but both held secret communication with each other and dedicated their lives to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Moiraine found the young man she sought on Winternight in Emond's Field, a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), along with two more _ta'veren_, [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and two women with the spark of the Power inborn, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Nynaeve al'Meara](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). When Moiraine was shortly raised to the shawl, she met [al'Lan Mandragoran](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), the uncrowned King of Malkier, who was fighting alone against the Shadow in the Blight; she asked Lan to become her Warder, and he accepted. She is very strong in the Power, stronger than almost all living Aes Sedai. In the Stone of Tear, Moiraine confronted and killed the Forsaken [Be'lal](#Be-lal) with balefire, just before he would have killed Rand. Later, after having an inkling of the future events from the testing _ter'angreal_ for the Wise Ones, Moiraine managed to push the Forsaken [Lanfear](#Lanfear) through the twisted doorway _ter'angreal_. Other Aes Sedai consider her a legend, not only for discovering the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) but for defeating two of the Forsaken as well. Despite her efforts, and for the most part, success, [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin) still thinks she “bungled” things with Rand.

name: Monaelle
info: Short Wise One (shorter than [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)) with red-streaked yellow hair to her waist and a mild, motherly face. She is weaker in the One Power than almost all Aes Sedai. She is the mother of seven, and served as the midwife at Elayne and [Aviendha](#Aviendha)'s Rebirth as first-sisters.

name: Morgase Trakand
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Former Queen of Andor and High Seat of House Trakand. Mother of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She married Taringail Damodred, a prince of Cairhien, to further solidify her claim to the Throne of Andor and keep peace between the two nations; when [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear) disappeared, Morgase made the best claim to succeed her, and married her widower to gain the support that would be gained by such action. Taringail was Elayne's and Gawyn's father; he died when they were young. Morgase has since gone through several lovers, including [Thomdril Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin), a former court-bard; [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), her First Prince of the Sword and Captain of the Guards; and most recently [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), a man who led the faction that stilled the riots in Caemlyn that sprang up on Morgase's trip to Tar Valon to inquire about Elayne's whereabouts. Thom was exiled from the city of Caemlyn when he started telling her what he really thought of some of her plans, her relationship with Bryne ebbed away until finally Gaebril told her to exile him too, and Gaebril eventually chased Morgase herself out of the city when she found he was usurping her power. The Daughter-Heir of Andor is traditionally trained by Aes Sedai in the White Tower, and Morgase underwent novice training to keep the tradition alive. She was given the gift of a Great Serpent ring despite not being Accepted, and still wears it on her left hand. She was previously advised by [Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) of the Red Ajah, who is now the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) in Tar Valon. When Morgase discovered that Gaebril meant to usurp her throne, she left, and when she learned that the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) had taken over Caemlyn and none of her former supporters would give her aid, she fled to Amadicia to get help from the only place she thought she could: [Pedron Niall](#Pedron-Niall) and the Children of the Light. She was not aware that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) only wanted to give her country back to her, not to mention believes that she is dead. If she had made her presence known, she would no doubt have had her country back in one piece, but as royalty she believed she must work on her own and trust no one. She went into hiding after the Seanchan attack (Valda believes her to be dead) under her mother's first name, [Maighdin](#Maighdin-Dorlain) to avoid instant recognition, and later became a maidservant to [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara); she told Faile that she was a lady's handmaid before coming into her service. When Faile's group was captured, she became a prisoner of the Shaido, and is now detained in their encampment. Her sign is three golden keys. A former member of the Queen's Guard, [Martyn Tallanvor](#Guardsman-Lieutenant-Martyn-Tallanvor), has taken a liking to his former queen, and she finds herself almost unconsciously returning his attentions. Her adopted son [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) believes her dead at the hands of Eamon Valda, and plans revenge on him. Her son Gawyn believes her dead at the hands of the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), and is only restrained from killing her by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s command. Her daughter Elayne believes her dead as well (though she as yet has no plans for vengeance), and her new mistress Faile has no idea of her true identity.

name: Moria Karentanis
info: Sitter for the Blue Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She proposed stopping pay for soldiers to save money. She is older than all other sitters except [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin); she has worn the shawl for over 100 years. She grew up in Illian.

name: Moridin
info: Moridin. His name means “Death” in the Old Tongue; no one deserves the name more. He is fond of using the True Power, the power drawn directly from the [Dark One](#Dark-One); the _saa_ have already appeared in his eyes, yet he still controls his use of the True Power (most thought it impossible to avoid drawing too much of it once the _saa_ appeared). Moridin is careful not to attempt to force the Pattern to behave how he wants it to—he knows that with someone as strongly _ta'veren_ as [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), that is all but impossible, not to mention foolish. Instead, he attempts to keep everything in chaos (as per the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s command, “Let the Lord of Chaos Rule”), hoping that subtle manipulations will further his goals. He has been declared [Nae'blis](#Nae-blis), the one to be second only to the Great Lord of the Dark after the Last Battle, and given control of the _cour'souvra_ controlling the minds of [Cyndane](#Cyndane) and [Moghedien](#Moghedien). He has also been granted the exclusive privilege of using the True Power—the other Forsaken are no longer able to touch it even should they want to.

name: Moril
info: Character in a song sung in the hell in Maderin to which [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) takes [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag).

name: Morvrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She is stout, and has graying hair. She is one of the six sisters who controlled much of the action in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. She is taller than her Warder, [Jori](#Jori), has a round placid face, and plump hands. She believes in a blending of common sense and logic, which makes her very hard-headed and suspicious of quick or easy solutions.

name: Mother Darvale
info: Wisdom, or the Altaran equivalent at least, of Runnien Crossing. She does a good impression of [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran).

name: Murel
info: Seanchan soldier. He tried to enter [Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show without paying. He nearly started a riot in the process; that may have been his intention all along.

name: Mylen
info: One of six _damane_ who were once in direct service to [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag). She is very short, shorter than Tuon. She is a special source of pride, as Tuon trained her herself. She was an Aes Sedai before being captured, but has been so changed by her captivity that she would betray a liberator.

name: Myrelle Berengari
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah with an elliptical face and olive skin. She is young (she has worn the shawl for about fifteen years) and known for her temper. She is now the Captain-General of the Green Ajah of the Tower-in-exile. She has four Warders named [Nuhel](#Nuhel-Dromand), Croi, [Avar](#Avar-Hachami), and most recently [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s old Warder who she is trying to save. She treats all of them as husbands in defiance of all law and custom, inside the Tower and out. She fled the White Tower when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed, along with most of her Ajah. She was one of the six sisters who held much of the power in Salidar despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. She received [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s bond after [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s death, bringing her Warder count to four, at least until [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) is ready to have him as a Warder. She seems to be the resident expert on saving Warders; three of her four (Nuhel, Avar, and Lan) were previously bonded to other sisters. She claims this is because she hates watching Warders die once their Aes Sedai is dead.

name: Nacelle Kayama
info: Tall, slender Malkieri Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah.

name: Nadere
info: Wise One of the Goshien Aiel. She is almost stout, and has green eyes. She is as tall as most men.

name: Nae'blis
info: The one who would stand only a step below the [Dark One](#Dark-One) on the Day of Return, commanding all Darkfriends in the Dark One's name. The position was promised to [Demandred](#Demandred) if he did well in his duties, as well as [Sammael](#Sammael), but it is likely that _all_ the Chosen were offered the position if they did well. The Nae'blis has been chosen: [Moridin](#Moridin).

name: Nagora
info: Short, lean, pale-haired Aes Sedai of the White Ajah in the Tower.

name: Nalesean Aldiaya
info: Late subcommander in the Band of the Red Hand. He was a blocky man, taller than [Talmanes](#Talmanes-Delovinde) or [Daerid](#Daerid). He led the other half of the Band of the Red Hand's cavalry, the part Talmanes did not command. He kept a pointed black beard.

name: Namene
info: Tall, slim Domani novice in the White Tower who giggles incessantly.

name: Nandera
info: Sinewy Maiden of the Spear with graying blonde hair. She led the Maidens of the Spear that came to rescue [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), and later assisted in his beating.

name: Naris Pelden
info: Young tirewoman that [Essande](#Essande-Dawlish) is training. She is [Sephanie](#Sephanie-Pelden)'s sister. She is fresh-faced, sturdy, and shy-eyed. She is very proud of her livery.

name: Ned Yarman
info: Warder bonded to [Sareitha](#Sareitha-Tomares). He is a tall, broad-shouldered young man with blond hair to his shoulders and bright blue eyes. He and Sareitha have been bonded less than one year. He helps the Andoran Guards by teaching them the sword.

name: Negaine
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She and [Felaana](#Felaana-Bevaine) found [Beonin](#Beonin-Marinye) in the Tower and sent [Anemara](#Anemara) to announce her presence to [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan).

name: Nemaris
info: Owner of [Nightlily](#Nightlily). Her husband claims she is on the delicate side, and does not like frisky horses.

name: Nengar
info: Man from Shienar. He is one of those now with [Masema](#Masema-Dagar).

name: Nerim
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: One of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s Redarms. He is short even for a Cairhienin, skinny, pale, and has gray in his hair.

name: Nerion
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s spies. He is actually [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s spy (she contends that spying is a wife's job), but Perrin is getting his reports in her absence. He is from Cairhien.

name: Neris
info: Serving woman in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn.

name: Nesita
info: Plump, blue-eyed Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She is as mean as a snake with the itch.

name: Nesta din Reas Two Moons
info: Late [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) to the Atha'an Miere. She was a woman who was used to getting what she wanted, with good reason. She was captured by the Seanchan, and is presumed dead.

name: Nevarin
info: Wise One with green eyes. She is tall, thin, and has long, yellow hair. She went with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to seek out [Masema](#Masema-Dagar). Perrin thinks she could give [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) lessons in getting angry.

name: Nicola Treehill
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Slender, black-haired, dark-eyed novice; she is about [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran)'s age. She was a refugee from Ghealdan. She has already developed several Talents, including the ability to see _ta'veren_ and Foretelling, although what she Foretells is usually in such language that only poets can understand it. Her potential exceeds that of all Aes Sedai currently alive, with the exception of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and Nynaeve. She has a limited ability to make _cuendillar_, but she is impatient in learning. She is very arrogant and can also be deceitful; she once tried to blackmail [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari), and [Nisao](#Nisao-Dachen). She used the fact that she could Foretell to be even more arrogant and demand even more special treatment. When Egwene refused to grant her that treatment, she ran away to the White Tower, thinking they would let her progress at the pace she wanted. She could not have been more incorrect, of course, and her life in the Tower is no doubt even more abysmal than it was before. It will get even worse if a sister ever finds out that she lied about her age; she is too old to be entered into the novice book by Tower law.

name: Nightlily
info: Horse [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) borrows to get to the Sitters as quickly as possible after news of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) reaches her. Her master claims she is “meek as milkwater,” but of course for Siuan that means very little.

name: Niolle
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: One of the First Twelve of the Atha'an Miere. She and the rest of the Twelve deliberately turned their backs on [Harine](#Harine-din-Togara-Two-Winds) to show their disdain for her failure. She has a round face.

name: Nisao Dachen
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She agreed to assist [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) with helping [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) because of problems she foresaw with his mind. Her specialty as a Yellow sister is psychiatric problems. She tried to help [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) with her headaches, but could not find the cause of them. Her Warder is named [Sarin](#Sarin-Hoigan). She is smart and observant.

name: Noal Charin
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Man who saved [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) from a _gholam_ in Ebou Dar by coming upon it and surprising it. He is stooped and white-haired, his nose crooked from breaking it. Most of his teeth are missing.

name: Noren
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Cairhienin horse handler in [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s camp.

name: Norie
info: _Damane_ that puts out [Grady](#Jur-Grady)'s “demonstration” to Tylee and her group of soldiers.

name: Norine Dovarna
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Big-eyed, dreamy Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She thinks that if the [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) is of the White Ajah, then _she_ should be the Keeper of the Chronicles. She has few friends, perhaps none, even inside her own Ajah.

name: Nuhel Dromand
info: One of [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari)'s four Warders. He also serves as a husband to her. He is dark-skinned and bulky with a curly beard that leaves a bare upper lip, in the Illianer fashion. He is one of the Warders Myrelle saved; his first mistress died.

name: Old Hob
info: Name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One) used in the post-Trolloc-Wars-era city of Shandalle, located in present-day Cairhien. Shandalle has the claim to fame of being the birthplace of [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Paendrag-Tanreall).

name: Olver
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Boy of nine who sat on the wrong horse and almost had his neck broken for the trouble. He was adopted after a fashion by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and his Band of the Red Hand. His parents were killed when the Shaido ravaged Cairhien. He is short, pale, and quite ugly. He likes to chase women. He is a good horse racer, and travels with Mat and [Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show. He has a certain fascination with the game Snakes and Foxes, and does not seem to understand that there is no way to win without cheating.

name: Oren Dautry
info: Nearest neighbor to the al'Thor farm. He is lean and tall, and a shameless borrower. [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) thought he may have some livestock he was willing to part with after the attack on Winternight. Oren has since joined [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) and the others to help [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: Osan'gar
info: Name given to the reincarnation of one of the Forsaken. It was the left-hand dagger in a form of dueling popular right after the creation of the Bore. The sport fell from common practice, since almost invariably both duelists died from the slow poison on the daggers. Osan'gar states that he helped make the Trollocs, indicating that in his past life he was [Aginor](#Aginor). Osan'gar was killed by the circle controlled by [Elza Penfell](#Elza-Penfell) at the cleansing of _saidin_.

name: Padan Fain
info: Former peddler that frequently came to Emond's Field. A Darkfriend, he was given orders to locate the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) and narrowed the list of candidates to to three boys in Emond's Field. While persuing them, he encountered the spirit of Mordeth in Aridhol, now called Shadar Logoth. Mordeth attempted to consume Fain's soul, but instead the two souls merged, producing something more evil than either of them alone. Fain no longer takes his orders from the Shadow; he has his own evil agenda. It is said, “The look of the Eyeless is fear,” from observing that a Myrddraal's look causes fear in the hearts of men. Fain's look has that effect on Myrddraal—Fades feel the same fear of Fain as men feel from a Fade. Fain is also called Ordeith, a name he adopted to become a Whitecloak officer. He is perhaps the most evil man alive. He now serves as advisor to [Toram Riatin](#Lord-Toram-Riatin), one of the Cairhienin nobles in rebellion to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Rand has a bounty of 100,000 gold crowns on his head—Fain killed Rand's friends because they were his friends, he pillaged his homeland because it was his homeland, and Rand intends to see him dead for it.

name: Panarch Farede
info: Panarch of Tarabon near the end of the War of the Hundred Years. She was responsible for promulgating the calendar that now bears her name, which measures years of the New Era (NE), the first of which marked the (arbitrary) end of the War.

name: Pavil Geranaeos
info: Clean-shaven Illianer, presently in Saldaea, who is attempting to buy gems from [Weilin Aldragoran](#Weilin-Aldragoran) when [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) comes to their table.

name: Pedra
info: Short, serious-faced Accepted. She guided [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to her room on her first day in Tar Valon. She is a short, wiry woman, slightly older than [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). She seemed unpromising at first, but now [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) thinks she will be raised to the shawl soon. She teaches classes to [Coride](#Coride) now.

name: Pedron Niall
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Former Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light, highest officer among the Children. He was one of the great military commanders of the world, in company with [Davram Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere), [Agelmar Jagad](#Lord-Agelmar-Jagad), [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde), [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne), [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and several Aiel chiefs. He was trying to get Altara and Murandy to cede land to Illian so the Council of Nine would not invade both countries. He also tried to expand Amadicia's borders into parts of Ghealdan. His headquarters were in Amadicia, and he ruled there even above [King Ailron](#King-Ailron), although this was not spoken of openly. Niall once offered a treaty with [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, offering Whitecloak assistance to retake her throne in exchange for Whitecloak presence in Caemlyn and elsewhere in Andor, a presence that Morgase had not allowed even a fraction of during her reign. Niall was killed by his alleged Spymaster, Abdel Omerna, who claimed he had gone against everything the Children stood for by allowing Morgase to avoid being put to the question. He was replaced by [Eamon Valda](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Eamon-Valda), who also killed Omerna. Rumor puts him dead in a duel or a skirmish.

name: Pelanna
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: One of the First Twelve of the Atha'an Miere. She has a long pink scar down the right side of her face and tightly curled gray hair.

name: Perrin t'Bashere Aybara
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: A young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. When he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) got separated from the rest of the group while fleeing the Trollocs on Winternight, Perrin met a man named [Elyas Machera](#Elyas-Machera). Elyas, a former Warder who found he could talk to wolves, helped Perrin discover the same ability in himself. Perrin's eyes are now yellow, just like the wolves' eyes, and he can enter what he calls the Wolf Dream (known to most as _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams) with them. Perrin is a childhood friend of fellow _ta'veren_ [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). On the way to Tear, Perrin encountered a young woman by the name of Zarine Bashere, a Hunter for the Horn who took the name of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) (which means “Falcon” in the Old Tongue) as a more appropriate name for a Hunter for the Horn. The two are now married. Perrin is a very large man—he was always a big person, which caused him to be very cautious since he found as a child that he could easily hurt other children if his temper got out of hand. His size helps considerably when helping Master Luhhan on his forge, but sometimes gives others the impression that he is slow and stupid. He returned to the Two Rivers for a time to repel the series of Trolloc attacks; he and his wife are recognized as Lord and Lady there, the first noblility of the Two Rivers since the Trolloc Wars. When he returned, he began to draw the eye of [Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron), the First of Mayene—Perrin wants nothing more than to be as far from her as possible, but Berelain will not take no for an answer, much to Faile's dismay and intense jealousy. Perrin was instrumental in freeing Rand from his entrapment at Dumai's Wells; the two had a fight afterwards (they had planned it as a way for Perrin to leave, although they most likely did not plan on it being as violent as it was), and Perrin went to Ghealdan to see if he could tame [Masema](#Masema-Dagar). On the way, his wife was captured by Shaido, and now he must track her down. He has a rope that he ties a knot in for every day she is held captive; he has plans in the making that should allow him to throw that cord away soon.

name: Petra Anhill
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Strongman in [Valan Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s menagerie. He has arms like tree trunks. Husband of [Clarine](#Clarine-Anhill). He is shorter than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), but about twice as wide. He can straighten a horse shoe with his bare hands.

name: Pevara Tazanovni
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She is short for a Kandori, and quite plump, but tough. She goes against all Red Ajah custom to openly say that Warders would make a Red sister's job easier. She and her friend since novicehood, [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon), began a hunt for Darkfriends in the Tower. Seaine approached her not only because they were friends, but because Seaine's family was killed by Darkfriends when she was young. She joined the Red Ajah because its task was one which involved being outside the Tower often, and she considered it more likely to be able to find and bring to justice the Darkfriends that killed her family and others like them. She now leads the organization of sisters in the White Tower to ferret out Black sisters, along with [Saerin Sedai](#Saerin-Asnobar), who seized control away from Seaine as soon as she knew what they were about.

name: Phaedrine
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. Neither she nor Shemari is strong enough to weave a gateway by herself, but linked they can just barely manage one big enough to walk through. She instructed [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) when Egwene was a novice in the White Tower; she still seems surprised that Egwene is now the [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat). She is lean as a heron, small-boned, and has dark hair and brown eyes. She is usually unkempt. She is good friends with [Ashmanaille](#Ashmanaille).

name: Pips
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s brown gelding. He does not look like much, but is actually a very good, sturdy horse.

name: Precious
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Pet name [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) made up for [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag). He made it up to get even with her for calling him [Toy](#Toy), but she did not interpret it in at all the same way he did.

name: Pritalle Nerbaijan
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah from Saldaea. She has green eyes, and an unusually small nose for a Saldaean. She is friends with [Atuan](#Atuan-Larisett), which makes those who know about Atuan suspicious that Pritalle may also be Black. She was among those who captured [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). Pritalle did her best to avoid teaching classes, and made little effort to disguise her loathing of it when forced to teach.

name: Queen Alliandre Maritha Kigarin
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Blessed of the Light, Queen of Ghealdan, Defender of Garen's Wall. She is the fourth person to sit on the throne of Ghealdan in the past several months. She wore jewelry to her meetings with [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) for the sole purpose of giving it to him such that he would not ask for anything more; she also sent a letter to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) offering him her friendship and asking for his help. She was subsequently captured by the Shaido Aiel, and is now working with [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) in an attempt to escape.

name: Queen Ishara Maravaile
info: First Queen of Andor, from whom all other queens are descended. Her husband was Souran Maravaile, one of [Artur Hawkwing](#High-King-Artur-Paendrag-Tanreall)'s best generals. She governed the Province of Andor until Hawkwing's empire finally fell apart and Andor became an independent nation. All of the Andoran nobles are related to her somehow, although most people would not even consider the ones who hold the closest relation to her to be related at all. None of her sons lived past age twenty, hence the tradition of only having a queen in Andor.

name: Queen Mordrellen Mantear
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, etc. before [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand). Her death and the previous disappearance of her daughter [Tigraine](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear) set off the Succession, called the Third War of Andoran Succession by those not from Andor. Her advisor was Gitara Moroso of the Blue Ajah. She is, unknown to everyone except [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) himself, Rand's grandmother.

name: Queen Tylin Quintara Mitsobar
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Altara, Mistress of the Four Winds, Guardian of the Sea of Storms, High Seat of House Mitsobar. Her kingdom was small, and she only ruled a portion of it; the rest was governed by nobles who were not necessarily loyal to her. She was the second from her House to sit on the throne—this was the maximum traditionally, and the only House to hold it for four generations fell so fast from power that it could not recover. She was advised by [Merilille Ceandevin](#Merilille-Ceandevin) of the Gray Ajah. She was a widow, and does not plan to marry again. She took an interest in [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and contrary to Mat's usual tactic of chasing women, _she_ chased and caught _him_. The two were lovers for some time. When the Seanchan invaded her nation, she cooperated with them out of necessity—they let her keep her position of authority, but she was a puppet of the Crystal Throne. When the Sea Folk fought the Seanchan, destroying much of Ebou Dar in the process, Tylin suggested Mat use the opportunity to escape the city, and tie her up under the bed to make it look like he had to restrain her to escape. While she was bound and gagged under the bed, the _gholam_ came, presumably to kill Mat, and she fell easy prey to it. She was found by [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath)'s people the next morning, torn limb-from-limb.

name: Radun
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Creator of a statistical measure that now bears his name, Radun's Standard of Deviation.

name: Rafela Cindal
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with a round face. She is now sworn to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She negotiated the treaty with the Sea Folk along with [Merana](#Merana-Ambrey). [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) says that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) should be able to trust her. She is now in Tear with [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), but the other Aes Sedai there are avoiding their notice.

name: Rahvin
info: One of the Forsaken. He was fond of using Compulsion, and was known for being a ladies' man—he always had a woman on his arm. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence in Caemlyn as [Lord Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril), and used Compulsion to have [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) not only make him her advisor, but her lover as well. He eventually planned to take over the country directly as the first ever King of Andor—he did his best to weaken support for Morgase, exiling her supporters and befriending those who opposed her, finally chasing her from the country as well. Shortly after news of Morgase's death or at least abdication reached Cairhien, Rahvin was confronted and killed by [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ with a weave of balefire strong enough to burn Rahvin's soul out of the pattern for days.

name: Rainyn
info: Apple-cheeked Sea Folk Windfinder. She serves on a soarer.

name: Ramesa
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She is tall and slender.

name: Rand al'Thor
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Young man from Emond's Field in the Two Rivers, now proclaimed to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). He is very tall, with curly red-blond hair. He was raised by [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) and his wife Kari (until her death around the time Rand was five) in Emond's Field. His real parents, however, were Janduin, the chief of the Taardad Aiel who brought the four clans across the Dragonwall to punish Laman's Sin, and a Maiden of the Spear named Shaiel, who was actually [Tigraine Mantear](#Lady-Tigraine-Mantear), the runaway Daughter-Heir of Andor. Tigraine gave birth to Rand on the slopes of Dragonmount, in accordance with prophecy; “born of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the Old.” Rand has a heron branded into each of his palms, which he received from the sword Tam gave him while fighting [Ishamael](#Ishamael). He also has two dragons on his forearms, which he received in Rhuidean to designate him as the _[Car'a'carn](#Car-a-carn)_, the Chief of Chiefs of the Aiel. He is not only the Dragon Reborn, but also He Who Comes With the Dawn, the man prophesied to reunite the Aiel, and the [Coramoor](#Coramoor), the one prophesied to bring the Sea Folk out of the Sea. He can channel strongly, more so than any person who ever lived (except the previous user of his soul, [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), who was obviously of equal strength), and is also _ta'veren_, the most strongly so since Lews Therin as well. Lews Therin's voice has somehow found a new place inside of Rand's head; he talks to him in a mad voice when Rand least expects it, sometimes offering sound advice or knowledge, sometimes babbling, sometimes even trying to wrest control of _saidin_ from him. Unlike Lews Therin, Rand is accompanied by two other _ta'veren_ during his turing of the Wheel, two men born within days (hours, even) of him named [Matrim Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), who both grew up in Emond's Field as well. Rand is destined to fall in love with three women (and has): [Min Farshaw](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Aviendha](#Aviendha). Rand has had success in fighting many of the Forsaken; all to confront him have died or been trapped. He killed [Aginor](#Aginor) at the Eye of the World after the Green Man killed Balthamel; he allowed [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) to kill [Be'lal](#Be-lal) in the Stone of Tear, and killed [Ishamael](#Ishamael) in the Stone shortly afterward; in the wagons near the Spine of the World, [Lanfear](#Lanfear) confronted him and was pushed into the land of the Eelfinn by Moiraine; he killed [Rahvin](#Rahvin) in _Tel'aran'rhiod_ when he came to the Royal Palace in Caemlyn; [Asmodean](#Asmodean), his teacher, was killed shortly after Rahvin met his fate; [Sammael](#Sammael) met his fate while fighting Rand in Shadar Logoth at the hands of Mashadar; and [Osan'gar](#Osan-gar), the reincarnation of [Aginor](#Aginor), died at Shador Logoth when Rand was cleansing _saidin_. During his duel with Sammael, Rand encountered a mysterious wanderer, presumably [Moridin](#Moridin), who helped him. During the fighting, their streams of balefire collided, causing Rand's head to spin and both of them to lose coherency for a while. Ever since that time, Rand has had trouble seizing _saidin_; it is not known if this is because of Moridin's presumed use of the True Power, or something else. Rand's prophecies fulfilled grow: he has already been born on the slopes of Dragonmount of a Maiden, of the ancient blood but raised by the old, taken the Stone of Tear and drawn _Callandor_, and began conquering “under the forgotten symbol,” that of the Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends. He is working on having the “spotless tower” (i.e., the White Tower) break and bend knee to him (the Tower has broken, and several Aes Sedai have sworn fealty to him and only him). He recently used the Choedan Kal, the two great _sa'angreal_ created during the War of the Shadow, to cleanse the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s taint from _saidin_. He has created schools of sorts, more research universities, where some of the best inventors of the day have congregated near Cairhien, Caemlyn, and Tear to develop new technology. Rand has also created the Asha'man, men who came for his “amnesty” for male channelers. With _saidin_ cleansed, the Asha'man are now safe from the [Dark One](#Dark-One)'s taint. The Asha'man themselves are not free from the Dark One's _influence_, however; there are many Darkfriends among the Asha'man, including [Mazrim Taim](#Mazrim-Taim), the leader of the Black Tower. The Asha'man under Taim have turned on Rand, trying to kill him and worse, though Rand does not at this point know that they were acting with Taim's knowledge. Rand is the salvation of the entire world, and as the prophecy states, he _will_ save the world—and Break it again.

name: Ravashi Paendrag
info: Daughter of [Radhanan](#Empress-Radhanan-Paendrag) and older sister of [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag), among the family of the [Empress](#The-Empress-of-Seanchan-) of Seanchan. She is close to Tuon's age, and according to Tuon believes she should have been named heir because she is older than Tuon. According to [Semirhage](#Semirhage), Ravashi is dead along with the rest of Tuon's relatives.

name: Reanne Corly
info: Eldest of the Knitting Circle, the ruling group among the women known as the Kin. She has blue eyes, and is quite strong in the One Power; she could match [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar), [Kwamesa](#Kwamesa), or Kiruna. She claims to be 412 years old. Publicly, she used to arrange shipping for small traders. Since the Kin were brought out of Ebou Dar due to the Seanchan invasion, she has been working on getting the Kin who could not escape out before the Seanchan collar them. She claims to be over four hundred years old.

name: Reene Harfor
info: [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s chamber greeter and First Maid of the Royal Palace in Andor. She keeps her gray hair in a neat bun. She has a round face, and always carries an air of regal dignity. She has taken it upon herself to ferret out spies in the Palace, and has found several.

name: Renaile din Calon Blue Star
info: Former Windfinder to the Mistress of Ships of the Atha'an Miere. After the death of [Nesta din Reas](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons), she serves as secretary to [Chanelle](#Chanelle-din-Seran-White-Shark).

name: Renna Emain
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: _Sul'dam_ who was charged to train and control [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) when she becomes a _damane_. She later gave her the nickname “Tuli, after one of Renna's former pets.” When Egwene escaped, she put an _a'dam_ around Renna's neck, and left it there when she fled. Renna was later discovered by [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami), wretching from the effort of trying to remove the _a'dam_ in vain. To protect the Seanchan way of life—which would likely collapse if it was learned that _sul'dam_ could learn to channel—Renna retained her rank as _sul'dam_, but was forbidden to be linked with a _damane_. She was kept under close watch by [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath). She was eventually spirited away by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Egeanin](#Egeanin-Tamarath), and the rest of the group that escaped Ebou Dar in the chaos.
