When she attempted to escape and warn the Seanchan of Mat's presence, Mat was forced to order her to be killed. She was killed by a crossbow bolt just before reaching the crest of the hill that would have meant her safety—and her betrayal of the Band of the Red Hand.

name: Rhadam Asunawa
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Gray-haired, bony-fingered High Inquisitor of the Hand of the Light. He wants every woman affiliated in any way with the White Tower hanged as of yesterday, every book that mentions Aes Sedai or the White Tower burned, and the very words banned. He would have [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) hanged for her months in the Tower if [Niall](#Pedron-Niall) had let him. He witnessed [Eamon Valda](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Eamon-Valda)'s killing of Omerna subsequent to Niall's murder. He commands what Valda describes as an odd respect among the Children, even among those who despise the Questioners.

name: Rhiale
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel, loyal to [Sevanna](#Sevanna). She has flame-colored hair and blue eyes.

name: Rhuarc
info: Tall, broad-shouldered, blue-eyed clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. He has gray streaks in his red hair. He has two wives: Amys, a Wise One, and Lian, roofmistress of Cold Rocks Hold. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) put him in charge of Cairhien along with [Berelain](#Berelain-sur-Paendrag-Paeron).

name: Rhys a'Balaman
info: Tall Murandian mercenary with a lean face and gray-streaked mustaches that he keeps waxed to spikes. He has eyes like stones and a thin-lipped smile that always seems a leer. He admires [Miheres](#Aldin-Miheres).

name: Rolan
info: Aiel warrior with blue eyes. He captured [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara), cut her clothes off, and carried her to their next camp. He later saved her from a drunken Nadric, who intended to have his way with her. He is one of the _Mera'din_, the Brotherless, who left his clan because he refused to follow [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) as _Car'a'carn_. He is no more than a hand shorter than Nandric, and almost as wide, making him a very large man.

name: Romanda Cassin
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah with solid gray hair and a high soprano voice. She is the eldest of the Sitters in the Hall of the Little Tower. She sat in the Hall for eighty years before retiring, and came out of her retirement when news of [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) and [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) came to her. She now leads one of the two factions in the Hall of the Tower under [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). She grew up in Far Madding. Romanda is also the First Weaver, the head of the Yellow Ajah.

name: Ronaille Vevanios
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She was stilled by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) during the battle at Dumai's Wells. She has since been Healed by [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn). She has been granted special privilege by the Wise Ones, and is free to come and go as she pleases.

name: Ronde Macura
chapter: Chapter 31: The House on Full Moon Street
info: Dark-haired seamstress from Mardecin. She was one of the eyes-and-ears for the Yellow Ajah. [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) once spotted the Yellow Ajah's signal outside her shop, and when she and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) went inside, Ronde drugged them with forkroot tea. She was going to send them off to Tar Valon as per the orders she was given until [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) and Juilin rescued the two women. Her failure to bring them back met with severe punishment; [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) uses her as a threat to people she has out searching for things. She is now in service of the Seanchan.

name: Rosala
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Servant of [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath). Suroth sends [Liandrin](#Liandrin) to her to be beaten; beating her herself would shame Suroth.

name: Rosebud
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: [Selucia](#Selucia)'s mare.

name: Rosi
info: Name [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag) was planning to give [Joline](#Joline-Maza) after she was collared.

name: Rovair Kirklin
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: [Masuri](#Masuri-Sokawa)'s Warder.

name: Ruthan
info: Graying Illianer who serves as clerk to [Geranaeos](#Pavil-Geranaeos) and Damentanis.

name: Rysael
info: Sea Folk Windfinder.

name: Saerin Asnobar
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah in Tar Valon from Altara. She carries a curved knife, in the fashion of her native Altara. She has touches of white at her dark temples which emphasize a thin, age-faded white scar. Only a Warder could match her for scowling. She has held her chair in the Hall for forty years, and has worn the shawl for over 150 years. Everyone knows to be wary of her temper. She was born the daughter of an innkeeper, and was first trained by the Daughters of Silence (an organization similar to, but shorter-lived and smaller than, the Kin)—she was the only one of them to ever obtain the shawl. She is good at taking charge of things, and immediately took charge of the organization to fetter out Darkfriends in the Tower with [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni), dismissing [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon) from her position.

name: Salita Toranes
info: Dark-skinned Sitter for the Yellow Ajah among the rebel Aes Sedai. She is from Tear, has a round face, and is almost as dark as the Sea Folk. She was raised to a Sitter after the sisters banded together in Salidar. She suggested a tax on the towns the Aes Sedai passed through to raise money for the ever-growing army. She has been an Aes Sedai only 35 years, which is too young to be a sitter—most sitters have worn the shawl over 100 years by the time they become sitters. She thinks it is wrong to sell objects made from _cuendillar_ that they have just made recently. She also thinks the Yellows are being unfairly drawn from Healing to make the objects (as if her Ajah's duty was more important than that of other Ajahs).

name: Samalin
info: Fox-faced Sitter for the Green Ajah in the rebel Tower. She grew up in Murandy.

name: Saml al'Seen
info: Soldier in the Black Tower from the Two Rivers (presumably). He was at the gates to greet [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) and the other Red sisters when they arrived.

name: Sammael
info: One of the Forsaken. During the War of the Shadow, he was one of the Shadow's greatest military commanders. His name means “Destroyer of Hope” in the Old Tongue. After being released from the Bore, he took up residence on the Council of Nine in Illian as Lord Brend, and effectively ruled the country. He wore a battle scar that he got while fighting [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) during the War of the Shadow. He could have had it Healed, but kept it to remind himself of what Lews Therin had done to him. He is believed dead at the hands of Mashadar.

name: Samwil Hark
info: Very successful catpurse in Caemlyn. He has been caught by the Queen's Guards only because another ruffian ratted him out. The only way to be so successful a catpurse is to not be seen by those you stalk, so [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) plans to use him to tail [Doilin Mellar](#Captain-Doilin-Mellar) at night to see where he goes.

name: Sanetre
info: One of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s personal bodyguards in the Queen's Guards.

name: Sareitha Tomares
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She has worn the shawl only a short time, only about two years. She grew up in Tear, and has brown hair and a dark, square face. She is among the sisters that are now sworn to obey [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). Either she or [Careane](#Careane-Fransi) had to have been the murderess of [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle), and thus Black Ajah; all other suspects have been eliminated.

name: Sarendhra
info: Blue-eyed Shaido Maiden of the Spear. She left her clan to follow [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: Sarin Hoigan
info: [Nisao](#Nisao-Dachen)'s Warder. A bald-headed stump of a man with a thick black beard, he still stands taller than his mistress, and seems to loom over her.

name: Saroiya
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in the rebel Hall. She sits on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s side. She is involved with the negotiations with [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan).

name: Sashalle Anderly
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She was stilled by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) during the battle at Dumai's Wells. She has since been Healed by [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn), and is now an apprentice of the Wise Ones and oathsworn to Rand. She even wears Aiel jewelry, and has since taken charge of the previously stilled sisters in Cairhien.

name: Seaine Herimon
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in Tar Valon. She has a fondness for cats. She was the daughter of a Lugard furniture maker, and is a bit above average height. When the Hall was arguing over who to raise as [Amyrlin](#Amyrlin-Seat) years back, it was deadlocked over four candidates who had each worn the shawl about fifty years; the Hall wanted an Amyrlin that was younger than the eighty or more years than were common. Seaine suggested [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), then a young Blue sister that had worn the shawl for only ten years; she was eventually raised. Later, Seaine was charged by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) to find Darkfriends in the Tower; Elaida hopes to expose [Alviarin](#Alviarin-Freidhen) on the suspicion that she is Black Ajah. She and her friend since novicehood, [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni), have successfully captured and bound with the Oath Rod a member of the Black Ajah, and have since dug out more Black sisters, even revealing that [Galina Casban](#Galina-Casban), head of the Red Ajah herself, was secretly Black. Seaine recently found that she was set to her task because of a misunderstanding: Elaida asked her how she was getting along “with discovering proof that Alviarin entered a treasonous correspondence with the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).” Elaida's exact words were, “We can never be sure who has the shadow of treason in her heart, Seaine. Why, I suspect that someone arranged for an order of mine to be countermanded. And I have reason to believe that someone has communicated privately with [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor); to what end, I cannot say, but that surely is treason against me, and against the Tower. I charge you to follow the stench of treason, no matter where it leads or how high, even to the [Keeper](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) herself. Yes, even to her. What you find, whoever it leads to, you will bring before the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat) alone, Seaine. No one else must know.” Seaine interpreted this to mean Darkfriends in the Tower, and therefore assumed Elaida could not be a Darkfriend. She and her associates are no longer so sure.

name: Sebban Balwer
info: Formerly [Pedron Niall](#Pedron-Niall)'s “dry little stick of a secretary.” He was in reality the Master of Spies for the Children of the Light; his identity was known only to Niall. His skills have proven useful to his new traveling group, [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company. He has a pinched face.

name: Selande Darengil
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: One of [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara)'s servants, one of the Cairhienin women who tries to imitate the Aiel Maidens of the Spear, only using swords instead. She is the leader of the _Cha Faile_ (Falcon's Talon) sept of the Aiel imitators. Selande is as tall as [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s chest (that is, _very_ short), and has a tail of dark hair at the nape of her neck.

name: Selucia
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: One of [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s servants; the one who shaves her head every morning. She has golden hair, piercing blue eyes, skin the color of buttery cream, and an “impressive” bosom. She is effectively a prisoner of [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), along with her mistress.

name: Semirhage
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: One of the Forsaken. During the Age of Legends, she was one of the best Healers ever known. She was called to all corners of the world Heal people that others thought beyond help. However, she was sadistic; she exacted a price in the form of pain from her subjects in return for her Healing services. Most thought the pain or anguish she exacted from them was a small price to pay for being alive, but eventually the Hall of Servants found out about her practices and gave her the choice of being either severed or bound with the Power, never again to know her “pleasures.” She chose instead to pledge for the [Dark One](#Dark-One), and created one of the most oppressive and pain-filled areas of Shadow control during the entire War of Power. After being freed from the Bore, Semirhage went in service to the Dark One by extracting information from captured Borderlanders and Aes Sedai. She also sent the Trollocs to the Stone of Tear to battle those that [Sammael](#Sammael) sent. She is as tall as most men, and wears black most of the time—perhaps because [Lanfear](#Lanfear) always wore white. It is often joked (or used to be, when the Forsaken were still bound) that when it rained during the daylight that the Dark One was beating her.

name: Sendara
info: Maiden of the Spear of the Iron Mountain Taardad.

name: Senine din Ryal
info: Sea Folk Windfinder of a soarer, one of the smallest of vessels in use by the Atha'an Miere. She was a Windfinder to the Mistress of the Ships before [Nesta](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons) succeeded her. She was then forced to start over from the bottom.

name: Seonid Traighan
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She grew up in Cairhien. She was part of Salidar's embassy to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). She now travels with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) and company. She has two Warders.

name: Sephanie Pelden
info: Young tirewoman that [Essande](#Essande-Dawlish) is training. She is [Naris](#Naris-Pelden)'s sister. She is fresh-faced, sturdy, and shy-eyed. She is very proud of her livery.

name: Serancha Colvine
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah, and Head Clerk of the Gray Ajah (the head of the Grays). She was a very strong advocate of Andaya being raised Sitter. She has a pinched mouth and nose and pale blue pinched eyes. [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon) and [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) put powdered itchoak in her shift when they were Accepted.

name: Sergase Gilbearn
info: Small, slim, dark-haired Andoran noble of a minor house. He has white streaks in his hair.

name: Serile
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: Windfinder to [Turane](#Turane). She looks slender compared to her mistress, but she is merely average.

name: Seta Zarbey
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Name of the _sul'dam_ that [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) collared before rescuing [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) at Falme. [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami) discovered her, wretching from the effort of trying to remove the _a'dam_ in vain. To protect the Seanchan way of life—which would likely collapse if it was learned that _sul'dam_ could learn to channel—Seta retained her rank as _sul'dam_, but was forbidden to be linked with a _damane_. She was kept under close watch by [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath). She was eventually taken along with [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and the others that left Ebou Dar. She has yellow hair.

name: Setalle Anan
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Stately former innkeeper of The Wandering Woman, the inn at which [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Olver](#Olver) stayed in Ebou Dar. She has hazel eyes, marking her a non-native to Ebou Dar. She worked closely with the Kin, and knew of their existence despite not being a part of them. She has a regal presence, and has a touch of gray in her hair.

name: Sevanna
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Wise One of the Jumai sept of the Shaido Aiel. She is the widow of the last two chiefs of the Shaido, Suladric and [Couladin](#Couladin), and has served as chief of the Shaido since Couladin's death. She will continue to do so until another chief can be chosen, but no one sees that event occuring in the near future. She has green eyes. She knows that the easiest way to power for herself is to attach herself to men who already hold power; she even envisioned marrying [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) (against his will) to gain power through him. She is currently leading her clan (and any Aiel deserters that joined her) through Ghealdan, where they were sent from Kinslayer's Dagger by [Sammael](#Sammael). She constantly wants more _gai'shain_—her goal is to indenture the entire world. She has recently taken a fancy to wearing silk, and wears nothing else. She is tall, has pale green eyes, and hair like spun gold. She would be beautiful except for the strong hint of avarice around her plump mouth. Little about her seemed Aiel beyond her eyes, skin, and hair. She also wears rings on every finger, and non-Aiel-made jewelry everwhere else.

name: Shaidar Haran
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: A Myrddraal of special abilities who escorts the Chosen (i.e., Forsaken) to the Pit of Doom to converse with the [Dark One](#Dark-One). He is head and shoulders taller than all other Myrddraal, who are the height of an average man and all the same height. His name means “Hand of the Dark” in the Old Tongue; most Myrddraal names come from the Trolloc tongue. He is given special consideration; the ceiling of the entrance to the Pit of Doom does not brush his head as it does everyone else's.

name: Shalon din Togara Morning Tide
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: Windfinder of Clan Shodein. She was left under a bed, bound with the Power and shielded, by [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), in the middle of the attack by the Asha'man. She has not been seen since.

name: Sharina Melloy
info: Grandmother recruited as a novice along the way from Salidar to Tar Valon. She has more potential than [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). She is dignified, and has gray hair that she keeps in a tight bun at the back of her head. She ran a very large family with a very firm hand until her children (and their children) grew up. She seems to have adopted all of the novices as granddaughters, or at least as great nieces. She was the woman who organized all the novices into “families”—she was apparently disgusted watching everyone simply floundering around.

name: Shein Chunla
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, later raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She began as a strong Amyrlin, firmly in charge of the Hall and the Tower, but by the end of her reign she was a puppet, doing exactly as she was told. The Hall mishandled events itself, too, leading to one of only six mutinies in Tower history, which pulled down both Shein and the Hall. She allegedly died of natural causes, but in fact she was smothered in her bed in exile fifty-one years later after a plot was discovered to put her back on the Amyrlin Seat.

name: Shemerin
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah, reduced to Accepted by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) against all Tower law. She ran away from the Tower after being reduced.

name: Sheraine Caminelle
info: Real name of [Mylen](#Mylen). She does not answer to it anymore.

name: Sheriam Bayanar
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with fiery hair. She was [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower before she fled to Salidar with the rest of her Ajah. She led the group of six sisters that held most of the influence in Salidar, despite not being part of the Hall of the Tower. Her tilted, green eyes can be used to intimidate novices and Aes Sedai alike. She is now the [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere). She is very efficient, but she hates the paperwork involved with being Keeper, and is often heard muttering under her breath that she wishes she were still Mistress of Novices.

name: Shielyn din Sabura Night Waters
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: Windfinder to [Zaida](#Zaida-din-Parede-Black-Wing), wavemistress of Clan Catelar. She is tall, slender, and cooly reserved. She is almost as tall as [Aviendha](#Aviendha). Like all Windfinders to Clan Wavemistresses, she wears eight earrings on one ear.

name: Silviana Brehon
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower. She is from the Red Ajah, and was appointed by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) after [Sheriam](#Sheriam-Bayanar) left the Tower. She is stocky, and has a square face. Elaida herself goes to her occasionally for “voluntary” penanaces.

name: Siuan Sanche
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah with shoulder-length hair. Born in Tear to a fisherman, she was sent to the White Tower on the first boat to leave after she discovered she had the ability to channel inborn, according to Tairen law. As a novice, she was good friends with [Moiraine Damodred](#Moiraine-Damodred), and was present at Gitara Moroso's Foretelling of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). After being raised to the shawl, she joined the Blue Ajah to dedicate her life to finding and guiding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), and eventually came to lead the Blues' network of eyes-and-ears (i.e., spies) before being raised to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She was only thirty years old when raised to the Amyrlin Seat, making her the youngest Amyrlin to that point. She was also one of the strongest Amyrlins in recent history, and one of the most feared among the rulers of nations. Her blue-eyed stare was feared by all. When her twenty-year connection to the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) was discovered, she and her [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles), [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif), were deposed and stilled by a group of sisters loyal to [Elaida a'Roihan](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan). Siuan hoped to regain some of her previous standing in the new Tower that separated from Elaida—her knowledge of the Blue Ajah spy network is hard to match, and she knows much that she thought would be of use. In one of her viewings, [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) saw that Siuan would have to remain close by to [Gareth Bryne](#Lord-Gareth-Bryne)—if she did not, both of them would die. Siuan did not initially know what she meant, but now realizes that she is growing to love the gray-haired man who leads the Salidar army. She had a Warder named Alric, but he died when she was deposed. After coming to Salidar, [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) discovered how to restore Siuan's ability to channel, at least partially. This resurrected a part of her bond with Alric, but did not bring back her former strength, or her binding by the Oath Rod. She can now lie as well as any child. She now serves as an “advisor” to the new Amyrlin in Salidar, [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere), but though she puts on a façade of hating the work, she is actually one of Egwene's foremost agents. The fact that she is Aes Sedai, not to mention one who was stilled and Healed again, makes other sisters tend to be oblivious to this fact. She was pushed very hard by Elaida as a novice.

name: Snowy Dawn
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: Irascible old wolf who once killed a leopard by himself.

name: Soong
info: [Ella](#Ella)'s mother, [Soong](#Soong)'s grandmother.

name: Soulblinder
info: Seanchan name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Stayer
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s horses.

name: Steady
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: [Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde)'s horse.

name: Stepper
info: One of [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara)'s horses, a dun stallion.

name: Suana Dragand
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah in Tar Valon, recently raised to a Sitter for the Yellow for the second time. She was hand-picked in a similar fashion to Juilaine, though she did serve in the Hall for forty years before resigning the first time. She is the First Weaver, the head of the Yellow Ajah. She is beefy, and has too much chin.

name: Sulin
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: Maiden of the Spear with white hair. She led [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s honor guard until she accidentally spoke to _gai'shain_ as if they were still Maidens of the Spear. To attempt to equal their shame, she became a servant in the palace, dressed in the same clothing they wore and attempted to behave in their manner. She ended her tenure as a servant when she learned that Rand had been captured, and led the rescue party of Maidens to Dumai's Wells. She then went with [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to find [Masema](#Masema-Dagar), and led the team of Maidens to search for [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara) when she was captured.

name: Sumeko Karistovan
info: One of the Kin. She is a _very_ Talented Healer, and has developed methods of Healing that not even [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) has been able to develop—in fact, the only thing similar would be the methods [Damer Flinn](#Damer-Flinn) has developed among the Asha'man. She is possibly the most skilled female Healer alive outside of [Semirhage](#Semirhage). She is stout, has confident eyes, straight black hair, a round face, and is very imposing. Unfortunately, Sumeko's abilities in Healing have caused her to occasionally rise above herself—one of her gravest errors was to call Nynaeve “girl.” She now frowns on anyone who uses the “traditional” form of Healing.

name: Swift
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: [Galina](#Galina-Casban)'s horse.

name: Sylvase Caeren
info: [Lord Nasin](#Lord-Nasin-Caeren)'s granddaughter and heir. She is sturdy, placid, unemotional, and quite pretty. She appears to have a cow's wits to accompany her cow-like expression. Actually, she rarely speaks. Her blue eyes appear vapid.

name: Tad Barran
info: Stablehand at the Winespring Inn in Emond's Field. He comes with [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) to help [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: Tai'daishar
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s big-chested sleek black stallion. His name means “True Glory” in the Old Tongue. He is a horse that draws attention.

name: Takima
info: Sitter for the Brown Ajah for almost nine years. She fled Tar Valon when [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) was deposed. She now sits with [Lelaine](#Lelaine-Akashi)'s Sitters. She is short, and has long dark hair to her waist. Her skin is aged and ivory-colored, and she is often described as quiet and bird-like.

name: Talaan din Gelyn
info: Boyishly slim Sea Folk Windfinder apprentice. She is almost as strong in the One Power as [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran). She is [Caire](#Caire-din-Gelyn-Running-Wave)'s daughter. She is only nineteen. She feels a lot of pressure to be prominent among the Windfinders—her grandmother is Windfinder to the Wavemistress of Clan Rossaine, her great-grandmother is Windfinder to Clan Dacan, and her great-great-aunt is Windfinder to Clan Takana, all in addition to her mother and aunt. She feels drowned by the expectations and higher standards set for her by her mother and others; she seeks to become a novice in the White Tower to escape. She has disappeared and has not been seen for some time.

name: Talene Minly
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Golden-haired Sitter for the Green Ajah in Tar Valon. She used to be [Seaine](#Seaine-Herimon)'s friend. She has no Warders, which is extremely unusual for a Green. When [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) shielded her because she suspected her of being Black Ajah, she tried to stab her. She actually _is_ a member of the Black Ajah, and is now sworn to obey Pevara and Seaine unconditionally. One of the three other Black sisters she knew of was [Atuan](#Atuan-Larisett).

name: Talmanes Delovinde
info: Cairhienin military commander, about three years older than [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and about a head shorter. His _con_ is three yellow stars on a blue field. His banner is a black fox. He rarely smiles, and reminds Mat of a compressed spring. He commands about half of Mat's cavalry in the Band of the Red Hand, and acts as the leader of the entire Band in Mat's absence. He is skinny, and has gray hair.

name: Tamlin (Tam) al'Thor
info: [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s father. He is a blocky man, and all his hair is now gray. He taught Rand about the Flame and the Void, a trick he uses to concentrate and to win archery competitions; Rand found that it is the way he can gain access to _saidin_. Tam is not actually Rand's biological father; he found Rand as a newborn on the slopes of Dragonmount and took him home with him since Rand's mother was dead. He was at Dragonmount as part of the Aiel War, which he left home to participate in when he was young. He became an officer in the Illianer army, and even achieved Blademaster status, acquiring a heron-mark sword. In fact, Demetre Marcolin served under him when he was a Second Captain in the Companions. He married a woman from Caemlyn, Kari, who he met while stationed there. When the Aiel War started, he fought Aiel all the way to Tar Valon and the Battle of the Shining Walls, where he found Rand on the mountain. Tam and Kari raised Rand as their own son. Tam always won the archery competitions (or came in second to Abell Cauthon), and passed his archery skills on to Rand. He also taught [Aram](#Aram) how to use his sword. Tam had no idea that the child he was raising was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Tamsin Ituralde
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: [Rodel](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde)'s wife. It is unwise to displease her, especially by getting killed, according to him.

name: Tarna Feir
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, now [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) in the White Tower. [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) sent her to Salidar to communicate with the Aes Sedai there and report about their camp and their numbers. She has long, pale, yellow hair, a strong jaw, and blue eyes that could freeze the Sun. She was a wilder, and had her block beaten out of her by [Galina Casban](#Galina-Casban); she and Galina were pillow friends as novices and/or Accepted, but Tarna rebuffed her advances once she gained the shawl. She is as jumpy as a novice, but has a cold manner. She came to [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) with a suggestion that Red sisters bond Asha'man as Warders.

name: Tarwin
info: Hero of old and subject of many songs and tales. He has a pass, Tarwin's Gap, named after him between Shienar and what was once Malkier.

name: Tavan
chapter: Chapter 31: The House on Full Moon Street
info: Broad-shouldered Cairhienin. He is one of [Careane](#Careane-Fransi)'s Warders.

name: Tebreille din Gelyn South Wind
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: Windfinder to Mereil. She is [Caire](#Caire-din-Gelyn-Running-Wave)'s sister and [Talaan](#Talaan-din-Gelyn)'s aunt. She and her sister do not get along well—they compete too much.

name: Tell Lewin
info: Young man from Emond's Field, now one of Perrin's soldiers. A bean-pole of a man with a thick mustache in the Taraboner style. He is [Dannil](#Dannil-Lewin)'s brother.

name: Temaile Kinderode
chapter: Chapter 31: The House on Full Moon Street
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Gray. A fragile woman from Cairhien with very big, blue eyes and a face like a fox. She always spread pain evenly in her mediating. She left the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin) with the first group of sisters to publicly admit themselves Black Ajah. [Yukiri](#Yukiri) does not like her much.

name: Tervail Dura
info: Dark-haired, bold-nosed Warder with a white, deep scar on his face. He is bonded to [Beonin](#Beonin-Marinye). He was on guard at [Logain](#Logain-Ablar)'s door when [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) Healed him. He is very lean, and has a strong nose. He has saved Beonin's life on at least twenty occasions. He is left-handed.

name: Teryl Wynter
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: One of [Seonid](#Seonid-Traighan)'s Warders. He is fair-skinned, and has curled mustaches. He is quite tall and slender, and is a very hard man.

name: Tesan
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah in Tar Valon. She is an arithmetist.

name: Teslyn Baradon
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah from Illian. She has a sharp face, narrow shoulders, gaunt cheeks, and a narrow nose. She was a Sitter for the Red for fifteen years until [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) was raised and asked her to step down from the Hall. Elaida sent her to Ebou Dar to meet with [Queen Tylin](#Queen-Tylin-Quintara-Mitsobar) of Altara. When the Seanchan invaded, she was captured and made _damane_. She was subsequently released by [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), and travels with him and [Luca](#Valan-Luca)'s show. She looks as if she chews rocks.

name: Tessi
info: Name given to [Teslyn](#Teslyn-Baradon) as a _damane_ under the discipline of [Bethamin](#Bethamin-Zeami). [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag) was planning to use the name for her after Teslyn was re-collared, too. She still uses it, in jest.

name: Thad Torfinn
info: Skinny man from Emond's Field. He and [Jon Ayellin](#Jon-Ayellin) dispute the boundaries of their farms. He rarely leaves his farm except to go to Emond's Field. However, he was convinced to leave with [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) to help [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara).

name: The Creator
info: Maker of the Universe, people, places, things, the True Source, everything in existence. An alternate name would be God. After He created the world, the Creator made a prison for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One), the Dark One, His complete opposite in every way, to keep him from influencing the world. The Creator is bent on non-interference—He will not directly influence events in the world, instead using a “Chosen One” or simply tugging at the Pattern of the Age in hopes that what He wants to occur will occur, instead of just making it happen. The Forsaken and most Darkfriends consider Him to be inferior to the Dark One, despite the fact that He imprisoned the Dark One.

name: The Dragon
info: Name by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known by during the War of the Shadow. His Rebirth, the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), is alive and fulfilling all of the Prophecies set to signal his return.

name: The Empress (of Seanchan)
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Supreme ruler of Seanchan. She is considered to be a direct descendant of the first emperor of Seanchan, [Luthair Paendrag Mondwhin](#Emperor-Luthair-Paendrag-Mondwhin). She presides over the Court of the Nine Moons in Seandar. She is [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s mother. The Empress is always referred to as “the Empress, may she live forever,” even when she is only referred to in thought.

name: The Prophet of the Dragon
info: Title given [Masema](#Masema-Dagar) as the self-appointed bringer of the news of the Rebirth of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon). He is not necessarily sane anymore, but has gained a very large following. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is getting to the point where he needs to do something about him, and sent [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) to Ghealdan with a few of the Asha'man and some of the sworn Aes Sedai to bring him in line.

name: Theodrin Dabei
info: Slim, willowy, apple-cheeked Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She was among the four raised to full sisterhood by [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere). Before being raised, she tried to dismantle [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran)'s block without success. The rest of the sisters still treat her like an Accepted. She has coppery skin, and grew up in Arad Doman. She has a stubborn set to her mouth, but she is warm to Egwene. She swore, of her own volition, to obey Egwene, and she is essentially spying on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin) for her now.

name: Thera
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Nickname for [Amathera](#Amathera-Aelfdene-Casmir-Lounault), the former Panarch of Tarabon, later dancer for [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath), and now girlfriend of [Juilin Sandar](#Juilin-Sandar).

name: Therava
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Wise One of the Shaido Aiel. She is stronger in the One Power than any Aes Sedai in the White Tower. She was the one who captured [Galina Casban](#Galina-Casban) after the battle at Dumai's Wells. She has very good eyes. She is one of the Wise Ones on [Sevanna](#Sevanna)'s side. Her appearance is pure Aiel, in stark contrast to Sevanna: gold and ivory jewelry, no finger rings or gems. She is taller than most men, has dark red hair touched with white streaks, and has blue eyes.

name: Theril
info: Lanky 14-year-old son of [Alvon](#Alvon). He is taller than his father, and the oldest of Alvon's sons. He rarely smiles. He and his father have been taken _gai'shain_ by the Shaido, though they seem restless; they have tried to escape three times.

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: Gleeman who came to Emond's Field on Winternight just before the Trollocs came. He is quite the ladies' man. Thom is good at juggling, sleight-of-hand, and all kinds of other tricks. He also carries several concealed knives up his sleeves, in his boots, and in various other locations on his body; this practice seems to have spread from Thom to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). Thom was originally a bard in [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s Royal Court, and for a time after her husband Taringail Damodred died, he was the Queen's lover. During his run from a Fade at Shadar Logoth, he was injured, and now walks with a limp because of it. Thom is getting old, such that he is starting to realize that he cannot do the backflips and other stunts he used to do. He accompanied [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) on their travels as per [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s request, despite the fact that he has never felt comfortable around Aes Sedai since his nephew, Owyn, was gentled by the Red Ajah. Thom is an expert in the Game of Houses; in fact, his girlfried Dena was killed by Cairhienin soldiers because they thought he was trying to play _Daes Daemar_ against the Royal House. He has recently taken to traveling with Mat and his entourage, ever since hooking up with him again in Ebou Dar.

name: Tiam of Gazar
info: Person who proposed the Gazaran Calendar, which celebrated the alleged freedom from the Trolloc threat by recording Free Years (FY). This calendar was adopted due to the chaos the resulted during the Trolloc Wars and the resulting confusion as to which year it actually was under the Toman Calendar.

name: Tiana Noselle
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She serves as [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) among the Aes Sedai who fled the White Tower. She is short and slight, and has large brown eyes and a dimple. She looks young despite her ageless Aes Sedai features.

name: Tod al'Caar
info: Young man from the Two Rivers. He is about a year younger than [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), and now serves as one of his bannermen. He has a heavy jaw.

name: Toke Fearnim
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Horse trader from Jurador. He has come by a razor, a specialized breed of horse from Arad Doman, which [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) is quite interested in.

name: Toma dur Ahmid
info: Person who devised the Toman Calendar, which was adopted approximately two hundred years after the death of the last male Aes Sedai and continued until the Trolloc Wars. The Calendar recorded years After the Breaking, or AB.

name: Tomas
info: Warder bonded to [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin). He is stocky, has gray hair, and is old and haggard though still quite spry.

name: Tornay Lanasiet
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Stocky Dragonsworn under [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s direct command. He is very eager to attack the Seanchan.

name: Toveine Gazal
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She spent fifteen years away from the Tower until [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) summoned her back to active service. She was formerly a Sitter for the Red. Elaida named her to lead the team of fifty sisters that she sent to Caemlyn to attempt to capture any men who can channel that they found. Unfortunately, she and Elaida drastically underestimated the number of men there would be, and Toveine is now [Logain](#Logain-Ablar)'s “wife,” their equivalent to Warders (actually, Logain has _two_ such wives now). Though she used to hate all men who could channel, and Logain in particular, she now fawns over him. She is short, and has coppery skin.

name: Toy
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Pet name [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag) uses for [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon). He hates it.

name: Tsutama Rath
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Golden-haired Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. Born of a butcher, she is extremely flamboyant and has no fewer than three clocks in her rooms. She has an extreme dislike of men. Tsutama resigned as a Sitter fifteen years ago and went into “voluntary” retreat after participating in the “disgusting events” of twenty years ago. When she returned, she was perceived as nervous and shifty, but now that she has been raised to the head of the Red Ajah (their Highest), that perception has been revealed to be incorrect.

name: Tumad Ahzkan
info: Young lieutenant in [Bashere](#Lord-Davram-t-Ghaline-Bashere)'s army, and commander of his personal escort. He could think clearly and see beyond what was in front of him. He was tall, though still two hands shorter than [Bael](#Bael), and had a thick black beard. Bashere was grooming him for a higher rank until he was killed by trollocs in Tear.

name: Turane
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: Stocky sailmistresss of the Atha'an Miere. She is gimlet-eyed and has a sharp twist to her mouth.

name: Turanine Merdagon
info: Aes Sedai of unknown Ajah. She had a strong face, tilted eyes, a hooked nose, and straight white hair to her waist. She died when [Beonin](#Beonin-Marinye) was still one of the Accepted, but Beonin saw her ghost outside Tar Valon.

name: Under-Lieutenant Caseille Raskovni
info: Under-lieutenant in the Queen's Guards of Andor. She is a lean, hard woman from Arafel. She spent twenty years as a merchant's guard, and is now a member of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s personal bodyguard. [Birgitte](#Birgitte) thought she would be a bannerman at heart.

name: Under-Lieutenant Kashgar
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Lean Saldaean Child of the Light. He serves as an Under-Lieutenant. His features are almost boyish, and he has a hooked nose and thick mustaches.

name: Uren din Jubai Soaring Gull
info: Sea Folk scholar and deviser of the [Farede](#Panarch-Farede) Calendar, which measured dates from the arbitrarily set end of the War of the Hundred Years as years of the New Era (NE). This calendar is currently in use.

name: Valan Luca
chapter: Chapter 6: A Stave and a Razor
info: Owner of the menagerie that [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) encounterd in Amadicia. He is still in business, running what he calls “Valan Luca's Grand Traveling Show and Magnificent Display of Marvels and Wonders.” He was near Ebou Dar when the Seanchan invaded, and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) convinced him to let in several members of his group and hide them from the Seanchan. He is easily persuaded with money, and is very stingy—except where his wife is concerned.

name: Vandene Namelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah, one of two Aes Sedai who went into voluntary retreat many years ago to Tifan's Well, a village located in the grassy plains of Arafel, along with her sister [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle). Their goal was some day to write the complete history of the World since the Breaking, and some even before that. They were both summoned back early, however, and they later came to Salidar to escape [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s summons back to the Tower. Vandene is now in Caemlyn, and has been joy-less since Adeleas's murder. She has dedicated most of her time to finding her sister's killer. She is slender, and has white hair.

name: Vane
info: Man who plays and loses to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) in a dice round in the common room of The White Ring before leaving the inn.

name: Varilin
info: Red-haired Sitter for the Gray Ajah in the Hall of the Tower-in-exile. She is inches taller than most men, and skinny. She sits on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s side. She has been the leader of the not-too-serious negotiations with the White Tower.

name: Venr Kosaan
chapter: Chapter 31: The House on Full Moon Street
info: One of [Careane](#Careane-Fransi)'s Warders. He has dark skin, gray in his curly hear, and a beard. He is blade-thin.

name: Verin Mathwin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah who accompanied [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) back from Falme to Tar Valon. Her Warder is named [Tomas](#Tomas). She is more interested in current events than the average Brown; most of them could not care less what happened now, only what happened years ago. She gave Egwene the twisted stone ring _ter'angreal_ to assist her in Dreaming, and also once told [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) that there was really no need to keep her in the Tower until she learned to control her ability when she was a novice, since she would never be able to do much with it anyway. When Verin went to the Two Rivers with [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), they helped to fight the Trollocs that attacked, and when they left they brought a half-dozen young women with them who could channel, including [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister [Bode](#Bodewhin-Bode-Cauthon). When she and Alanna reached Caemlyn, they found that the Tower had been broken, and decided to side with the Salidar embassy when it reached town. Verin is quite old—her hair is starting to turn gray, which to an Aes Sedai means she is quite old indeed. She is now with [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin)'s group of sisters in Tear.

name: Wallein
chapter: Chapter 22: To Make an Anchor Weep
info: One of the First Twelve of the Atha'an Miere. She and the rest of the Twelve deliberately turned their backs on [Harine](#Harine-din-Togara-Two-Winds) to show their disdain for her failure.

name: Weilin Aldragoran
info: Seller of gems, rare woods, furs, finely-made swords, and armor in Saldaea. He is Malkieri, and still wears the _hadori_. He was a toddler when Malkier was overrun.

name: Welyn Kajima
info: Dedicated in his middle years. [Toveine](#Toveine-Gazal) thinks he smiles too much. He is the “husband” of [Jenare](#Jenare). Before coming to the Black Tower, he was a clerk in Arafel—he looks like a clerk. He wears his hair in braids and bells just like [Jahar Narishma](#Jahar-Narishma).

name: Wilbin Saens
info: Andoran merchant, dead four months. [Samwil Hark](#Samwil-Hark) claimed to have worked for him.

name: Willi
info: Character in a song sung in the hell in Maderin to which [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) takes [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag).

name: Winterfinch
info: [Beonin](#Beonin-Marinye)'s horse.

name: Young Bull
chapter: Chapter 25: Attending ElaidaChapter 26: As If the World Were Fog
info: Name the wolves use for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). It is actually an image, one of the simpler ones in fact, much more complex than simply “Young Bull.”

name: Yukiri
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She is quite small, and is a Sitter for the Gray. She was the daughter of an innkeeper, and is always the last Gray to join the Gray consensus in the Hall. She is now an ally of [Saerin](#Saerin-Asnobar) and [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) in hunting down Darkfriends in the Tower.

name: Yurith Azeri
info: Guardswoman in the Royal Palace in Caemlyn. She and observed [Merilille](#Merilille-Ceandevin) leaving the city with one of the Sea Folk apprentices, presumably [Talaan](#Talaan-din-Gelyn). She gives daily lessons in the sword to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s bodyguard. She is an excellent conversationalist and well-educated, but she is silent about her past.

name: Zaida din Parede Black Wing
info: Wavemistress of Clan Catelar of the Atha'an Miere. She is very commanding, and expects obedience from everyone. She is short, quite beautiful, and has streaks of gray in her tightly-curled hair. Her dark face appears to grow more beautiful with the passing of time. Zaida was the the ambassador to [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) from [Nesta din Reas](#Nesta-din-Reas-Two-Moons), [Mistress of the Ships](#Mistress-of-the-Ships) to the Sea Folk, until Nesta's death at the hands of the Seanchan. Zaida herself has been chosen to replace Nesta as the Mistress of the Ships.

name: Zaired Elbar
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Servant of [Suroth](#High-Lady-Suroth-Sabelle-Meldarath). Like his mistress, he is _Atha'an Shadar_, Those Bound to the Shadow. He is particularly good at disposing of bodies.

name: Zanica
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Aes Sedai involved in capturing [Leane](#Leane-Sharif). She has one Warder. She insisted on nearly killing the coach horses to gallop back to the Tower.

name: Zarya Alkaese
info: Real name of Garenia, the name she used as a novice before [Vandene](#Vandene-Namelle) and [Adeleas](#Adeleas-Namelle) left on their retreat to Tifan's Well. She has a strong nose and a wide mouth. She is actually over ninety, but she looks like she is not yet into middle age. She has since been forced back into novice white and is learning from [Vandene](#Vandene-Namelle). She grew up in Saldaea.

name: Zerah Dacan
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Slim, black-haired Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She has a prideful air, and has been Aes Sedai for less than fifty years. She originally fled to Salidar, but was sent back to Tar Valon to keep suspicion from growing and to spread the stories about [Logain](#Logain-Ablar) being set up by the Red Ajah. She has since been discovered by [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) and company, and is bound by the Oath Rod to obey them.

name: al'Lan Mandragoran
info: The uncrowned king of Malkier, and formerly Warder to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). He is quite tall, and does not get very emotional—in fact, he has emotional walls all around him that he has been building for years. His country, Malkier, was overrun by Trollocs shortly after he was born, and is now corrupted by the Great Blight. Lan, among the last of his people, then proceeded to fight a one-man war against the Shadow by killing Shadowspawn in the Blight. He fought Aiel during the Aiel War, and achieved Blademaster status. He was eventually bonded by Moiraine, which ended his lonely fight (or at least changed its style). When Lan and Moiraine brought [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) out of their home in the Two Rivers, he found that there was something which could throw his guard down, but he was the last to notice it: affection for Nynaeve. As Moiraine put it, Nynaeve was able to plant vines in Lan's emotional walls and break them down without him even knowing they were there. The two of them are now married. According to the terms of their vows as taken before the Sea Folk, one of them must obey in public while the other obeys in private; for obvious reasons, Nynaeve is the one who commands in public. Upon Moiraine's death, Lan's bond was immediately transferred to [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) until Nynaeve is ready to have his bond transferred to her. Myrelle tried to keep Lan's status secret, but she was given away when she tried to buy one of Lan's favorite foods, coin peppers, too far south (they are very popular in Shienar, and were in Malkier before it fell to the Blight, but do not grow well in southern climates). Upon learning of where Lan was, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) sent him to Ebou Dar to serve as a Warder for Nynaeve. He now travels with his wife and the group of Aes Sedai she accompanies. According to the Wise Ones, _Aan'allein_ (as the Aiel call him) will die the day he learns that Nynaeve is dead. He is one of the best, if not _the_ best, warriors (and Warders) in the World.

name: el'Nynaeve ti al'Meara Mandragoran
chapter: Prologue: Embers Falling on Dry Grass
info: Young woman from Emond's Field, now an Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She was the Wisdom of her village, the youngest such ever chosen in Emond's Field. She left when four of her villagers were taken away from the Two Rivers by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran). While the group traveled away from her home and toward her new life, Nynaeve made several discoveries: she could channel the One Power, and had already done so without really knowing what she was doing; she developed feelings for Lan Mandragoran, Moiraine's Warder and the uncrowned king of the now dead nation Malkier; and she has a major role to play, as all of her younger friends in the group do, in the years to come. She is very strong in the One Power; only a select few who were alive during the Age of Legends could match her as well as a few young women still being trained. When she arrived in Tar Valon, she was raised Accepted without any tenure as a novice, despite not being able to even _sense_ the True Source unless angry, a result of her having to learn some minimal control of her ability without teaching. She was sent on a false mission by [Liandrin](#Liandrin) on which she was almost leashed by the Seanchan as [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) was. After she returned to the Tower, [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) sent her on a mission to hunt down Liandrin and her fellow Black Sisters; while hunting them in Tanchico, she encountered [Moghedien](#Moghedien) and managed to better her in a duel of the Power. Moghedien escaped, but two encounters later Nynaeve once again managed to get the better of her, leashing her with an _a'dam_ in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Nynaeve took Moghedien with her to seek out [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Rahvin](#Rahvin) while they were fighting each other, and at the last moment before Rahvin might have won, she nearly burned Rahvin to ash with a giant weave of fire that was most of what Moghedien could draw to produce it; the distraction was enough for Rand to regain control of himself and destroy Rahvin with balefire. Nynaeve then kept Moghedien under control with a modified _a'dam_ in Salidar. Nynaeve wished to become Aes Sedai for the sole purpose of Healing; she thinks the Tower meddles in the affairs of nations far too much, and wants no part of it. She is determined to Heal anything short of death, and has already managed to Heal gentling. Nynaeve felt bad when Moiraine died, because her first thought was not of her, but that now Lan was free from their bond. She was not told that Lan's bond had been passed to [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) at the moment of Moiraine's death. She and Lan are now married, and the plan is for Lan's bond to pass to her as soon as she and Myrelle can get together. She now wears the _ki'sain_, an ornament traditionally worn by Malkieri wives, consisting of a dot on the forehead between the eyes—Lan did not tell her of this tradition, but when she found out she immediately took it up. It is the one element of her appearance that never fades for one second when every other part changes faster than the eye can follow in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Because she was the only person Rand felt he could trust to link with him and the Choedan Kal, he asked Nynaeve to assist him when he cleansed _saidin_. She now carries the _ter'angreal_ she found in Ebou Dar nearly all the time.
